text: Zero complaints except maybe that I wish the place itself was larger! The atmosphere is spot on, it has the feel of beach taco shop for sure. The outdoor seating area is awesome, super fun place to kick back with friends! The tacos were sooooo good and prices were reasonable! Crab fries were yummy!!! The owner was super cool and making his rounds, service was spot on. I will def be back!!!

This taco shop is delicious! We go as often as possible. 

The only issue was how slow the service can be at times. Other than that, Tacos are delicious!

Amazing fresh fish! Just moved from Chicago and have never had such fresh seafood.
Great margaritas also.
Staff is super friendly and fun!

Been wanting to try this place out for a while and so glad I finally did. The service was excellent, the food was excellent, and the menu is fairly priced. I ordered a Thresher Shark Taco, Lobster Taco and a shrimp taco with mussels to start SOOO Good!
love so cal a cheery beachie feel been. comming here sinced it opened fab fish tacs ! sides and sauce a must love the. ice cream cookie !

Great tacos! Better, cheaper, and less pretentious than Joy Ride which is down the street. I was expecting to order at a counter like Rubios, but this is a sit-down restaurant. I will definitely be back.

I live close to downtown Gilbert and frequent here often. I have always enjoyed the food and the service ranges between adequate and excellent. I love the outdoor seating in the back during the winter where I can sit out there all night sipping on mini Corona beers and enjoying their lobster taco and amazing crab cakes. The baja sauce is delicious.

We decided to try this restaurant and it was a mistake. Their service was terrible, (filled my own drink) they forgot half our order, food is mediocre compared to a competing taco restaurant down the street, and they didn't check on us once after they gave us the food. We were very disappointed.

Nice small place that is very welcoming. The customer service is outstanding, and the tacos are some of the best I've had. The blackened grouper is my favorite.  Stop by and try it, you won't be disappointed!

The chicken tortilla soup was excellent...big pieces of rotisserie chicken and a light, flavorful broth. The shrimp Caesar salad was good but boring. Fresh and crisp romaine with perfectly cooked shrimp, but there was no seasoning on the shrimp and nothing in the salad but cojita cheese and tortilla strips and too much dressing. I would have loved some big slices of avocado...after all it is a SoCal restaurant! I'll try tacos next time unless they make their salads a little more flavorful. Also strange that you pay a waitress to bring you a drink from a fountain that is right in front of you. I like being served at a restaurant, but if you choose to dine in it would be nice to at least have real glassware and silverware instead of plastic.

2nd time to So Cal and it was as great as the last! The Mexican Shrimp Cocktail is packed with big fat fresh shrimp, almost like a ceviche, but very good. I ordered just regular fish tacos and they were delicious, I LOVED THE RICE, just perfect and our waitress was sweet and attentive. Met one of the owners while there, nice guy and excited that we were excited! 

I don't know why anyone would give this place one star, but everything was great! 

Others in my group had the ahi tacos and clam chowder and loved them both.
Had the tamale, it was pretty good. Blackened grouper taco was pretty good as well. I would suggest giving it a chance.

By far the best fish tacos in AZ. I have tried other items off the menu as well and all have been awesome! HIGHLY recommend for all of you seafood lovers. They have amazing crap cakes, a good fish sandwich, and superb shrimp tacos. Priced very reasonable as well.

Great beer battered fish. Tortilla didn't seem fresh as they were a bit stiff. Portions a bit small compared to local competition. Being from San Diego just expected a little bit more food for the price. Beans and rice were flavorful but again kids portion (think Rubio's portion). If they manage to break the size barrier I would be back. Great atmosphere reminded me of home.

Just ordered the Shrimp Tacos.  Service was great - the food came out quickly.  Food is awesome.  I don't normally like pinto beans but these are awesome!  I came for lunch - but I just told my wife I'd be down to go back for dinner! :)

Tried the Mahi Tacos. Served with beans and rice. Rice was good but the beans were nothing special.  The tacos were refreshing.
My only complaint was the owner/manager had a bit of an attitude and kept criticising the servers, who I thought were doing a fine job.

First time, not impressed. Seating is mostly outdoors and with the weather these days not comfortable at all. Water drips on you and your food from the misters. Food is good, but not expectacular for the  prices; chips n salsa are extra. Overall it lacks ambiance and the manger needs to put a smile even during cahos. Orders get mixed up, too many hands taking food to tables.
Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Relaxed atmosphere and incredible food! Best shrimp taco I've ever had. The ahi tuna taco was also very delicious. Reasonable prices.

Compared to La Santisima, this taco shop was a step down - same price but not nearly as good. The fish was well spiced and well cooked, but the tortilla did not hold up to the salsa or the fish. Halfway through both tacos, the tortilla just broke - a taco crime!

Let me start by saying this place is WAY overpriced for what you're getting. I had the cod tacos, which were good. However, the tacos were pretty small and not tasty enough to be worth $9 by themselves. 

My wife got the carnitas tacos and those weren't good at all. The meat had no flavor and the tacos were minuscule. 

The calamari fries were pretty good, and the aioli sauce that came with it was tasty. 

So, if you like Rubios I'd suggest going there over this place, or go to Mangos in Mesa. Your bill will be cheaper and the food will be better.

I was really excited for this place, but it was just bad. I got the Fish and Chips and won't be getting it again. It wasn't cooked all the way, wasn't crispy at all and the annoying part was it was $7 for two little pieces of fish and hardly any fries. My date got the fish tacos, but where was the fish? It was all mangos and veggies. Sorry, but were not impressed.

The food was amazing!  We started with the clam strips and then had the SHARK tacos and the beer battered magi tacos!  So delicious with a good beer which they have a good little selection!  The service was top notch!
Good fish tacos, had the Mahi Mahi. My only sad face was they don't give chips with the salsa.

I wanted to love it...grew up in Huntington Beach, surfing in Baja (ensenada, rosarita, etc).  Raised at Wahoo's Fish Tacos and have a decent palate when it comes to fish tacos.  

Service was fine.  nice folks, speed was good.  The decor/patio gave me hope.

Our Group Ordered:  Quesadilla.  Shrimp Tacos.  Mahi Tacos.  Blackened Grouper tacos.

Quesadilla:  $4 for 1 store bought tortilla basically warmed in a microwave.  Like you would make for a snack for a toddler at home.  Weak.  

Shrimp Tacos:  decent.  Server said there were 5 shrimp per taco, mine had 3 shrimp.  Much better at cafe rio up the street.

Mahi Tacos:  lacking flavor.  Looked good.  let down.  wouldn't order these again.

Blackened Grouper:  also, lacked flavor, but the best of the 3 i ordered.  Note:   as i understand it, "blackened" is both a way of cooking (using butter/oil to char the fish, plus usually a cajun/pepper spice).  Again....this is NOT Wahoo's "blackened" fish  

Tap water:  awful.  even w/ lemon.  Get drinks...or soda water at least.

I will return, as i want them to succeed....I will try the other taco's and update.

Happy Hour: Mon - Thurs i will try the Cod Tacos...i think they are $1 buck a piece

The food was amazing and the service was awesome.  Unfortunately, while we were eating we saw what appeared to be the owner of the restaurant park his giant pickup truck in the disabled parking space.  After he unloaded some supplies, he continued to leave it parked in the disabled parking space.  I saw an elderly woman with a walker walk past his giant truck and go to the main lot because there weren't any more available parking spaces for disabled people.  Because of this, I am giving a low rating and won't return.
Great cod tacos! Really good customer service as well.

I found this place by accident, and what a find it was!!  The shrimp tacos are amazing.  I can't stop thinking about them.  I would drive to Gilbert just for those tacos.  I also ordered the steamed clams.  If you're from New England, be prepared, as these are the hard shell clams from New Jersey.  Still very good, but not the big bellied, soft-shelled clams from New England.  I also ordered crab cakes... they were just okay.  Tasty.  Would I order them again?  Maybe.  The clam chowder was pretty good.  Not the best I've had, but certainly worthy of a A in my book.  It wasn't overly spiced.  Sometimes clam chowder is packed with too much black pepper, but this wasn't, and it was good.  Chunks of clams.  When I'm craving a taste of home, I'll be heading to this little joint.  (Maybe next time will try some of their micro-brews.)  I have to say for Arizona seafood fare, I will certainly be going back.

My parents love to eat here. The chips and salsa are pretty good. I really liked their fish tacos. They didn't have that fishy taste to them and they cooked perfectly  . It looks like it is small but they a really nice patio area that is great before the heat comes

Not impressed! Service was just 'OK'. Ordered a water and it tasted like chemicals. Ceviche was decent. My wife got horribly sick from her ahi tuna tacos. Had it coming out of both ends if you know what I mean! Won't be heading back there anytime soon.

Excellent food. My wife had the clam chowder and it was fantastic. The Mexicali shrimp cocktail was amazing.  The ahi tuna tacos were very good and so were the grouper tacos.  My wife had the sangria and it was great. They make it homemade and its not that sweet. Its a small place in old town Gilbert and it has a patio. The owner is cool. A must if you are in the area.

This place was just 'OK'.

Service (2 stars): There were no patrons inside, which was great! It was such a nice night out that everyone was out on the patio. That said, my expectations for immediate service was way up there (there goes wishful thinking). 

The young lady originally outside on a break came in to greet us. She brought us menus and politely mentioned that our "server" would be with us shortly. After about 10 mins, said server approached us and said he'd be right back to take our order. His name was Jared.

Hmmm...so we wait The young lady circled back and took our drink order. Shortly thereafter, she took our food order. Where is Jared and why hasn't he returned? 

No chip n salsa? Why am I paying $3 for chips and salsa?  This establishment os clearly listed Mexican, so I'm expecting chips n salsa...free of charge.

Food (3 stars): While it was awesomely fantastic it wasn't horribly bad either. I ordered Shrimp tacos at the suggestion of the waitress while the juvenile ordered Fish n Chips. My belly was full so no real complaints. Waste not, want not.

Establishment Cleanliness (3 stars): The bathroom had paper towels on the floor which meant no one was tending to it regularly. With the inside being completely empty (again, myself and the juvenile only) so I expected to see swept floors and wiped down tables. 

We sat at a table near what appeared to be the entrance/exit to the Cocina. Was NOT expecting to see trash bins barreled out past the table I was eating at. Aren't there back doors for that? 

Overall they get 2.6 stars, but since I can't rate in that manner I guess they get the benefit of a round up

This place is killer.  Takes me back to the beach every time I eat there!  ANY of their fish tacos are to die for as well as the calamari and clam chowder!  Would eat here any day over their rival Joyride across the street.  Well done SoCal... Well done!
Cute boys & great food! The grouper fish tacos are AMAZING. I tried a few appetizers and wasn't disappointed. Overall great food for a good price.  Love.

Super yummy and filling! We will defiantly be back. We had 3 different kinds of tacos at the table and they were all amazing!!!! Everything was absolutely delicious!!! The ice cream sandwich that finished it all off was just the icing on the cake! Small and cozy but with a great outdoor space this is a great place for a date or to meet a friend for lunch or dinner. Very reasonably priced!! Great little find!!! Can't wait to go back!

Came for lunch with the wife during their  'soft' opening. I believe the problems we had will be worked out. Wait for a table wasn't bad, got sat outside and had to play musical chairs a bit to not sit in a sunny spot or a spot getting dripped on by the misting system. 

Got the crab cakes to start with, which were excellent. I got the shrimp po-boy, and the wife got the fish and chips.

Fish and chips were a tad to thick on the batter. The shrimp on the po-boy was a corn-meal crusted fried shrimp, pretty good as well.

I dislike tarter sauce, but the 'house' tarter sauce is really excellent!

My only disappointment was the lack of any other 'house' sauces. In all my "So-Cal" fish tacos experiences, each place had an assortment of their very own specialty sauces. The lack of anything but tarter here was a disappointment.

tl;dr 4 stars for now, it's still too new and has some issues to work through, it'll be a 5 star soon enough.

Finally got around to visiting this place and it was better than expected. Saturday night and the place was full - for good reason. Nice fresh blue point oysters on the half shell, steamed clams ( steamed in broth which was almost better than the clams!). Fish ceviche - tasty, fresh - actually got one to go. Tamale del Mar with pablanos - didn't overwhelm the seafood. All the sides - slaw, beans, rice weren't swimming in whatever sauce which made them stand out for their own taste. Definitely will revisit - have to try the tacos next time! Don't know why we didn't but all the other items looked great and were great.

We had high hopes but were let down. Service was very good. We went at 6ish on a Thursday and were seated indoors right away. Staff was friendly and attentive and we always had full drinks!  Food was just okay. The batter seemed too heavy (fish and chips and cod tacos) and meal was pretty bland. I guess it lacked what I'd call that "fresh" taste. Now I understand that because we live in the desert we will never get fish tacos like they serve in CA but....

The Republic gave this place 4 stars and i agree.  Unique little place.  Food is fresh, service is good, and the patio is great too.  Went for lunch with my wife and we were impressed.  Two mahi tacos stuffed with mahi mahi and fresh mango for 7 bucks!  You would be hard pressed tonget street tacos at that price.  We had clam chowder for 3 dollars that was house made.  The chowder was excellent.  Go to Paradise Bakery for canned chowder and pay twice that price.  Also had the steamed clams.  We got two dozen clams in a bucket for 9 dollars!  They were fresh and sand free.

I will be straight forward here.  This is the kind of place you'd find in a coastal town except the quantity is better.  If your looking for a casual, flip flop wearing locale to have awesome food and a cold Corona this is the place.  Local small business with fresh made food.  Highly recommended!

Also, they have a solid selection of San Diego micro brews.
Great chicken soup! My favorite, service is always excellent. Love coming here with the family.
Yum. Blackened grouper tacos. Yum. Mahi tacos ate good if you eant something milder. All that was missing was the sand.
Food was a little cold. Do not try the clam chowder. Don't really understand how it can be award winning. Wanted it to be so much better. Disappointed for sure.
Fresh and tasty. This place reminded me of the beach. Look no further for the best fish taco.

the lobster tacos over priced, bland and taste rubbery. The ceviche tacos are very bland and also overpriced. If you ever had authentic or half decent seafood tacos you will be disappointed. If you want to sit out in a nice patio and have a beverage this could be the place, just make sure you eat before you arrive!

Just left and the food was terrible. The scallops had no flavor, had to kill the taste of the fish with ketchup and tarter sauce, clam chowder tasted like a bowl of flower, and the tortilla soup was nothing but beans. Never going back. So-crappy fish taco company!!!
Great place.  Tried almost everything on the menu and it's all good.  Unique thing about So Cal is it's clean food, not drowned in melted cheese and sauce.  And yet it's so flavorful!

GOOD FOOD and good VALUE! ....However...I will NEVER understand how OWNERS, GM's, Floor Managers do not prepare their servers and require their servers to perform the BASICS of GREAT service!!  Simple Steps of Service!!   How are you folks doing today?.....Great my name is BLANK.....HAVE YOU FOLKS been here before???  Yes?  Welcome BACK!  NO?  Welcome for the first time!!  EXPLAIN WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOU WANT TO BE KNOWN FOR!!!!!!  YOUR FAVORITES....ANY SPECIALS....SUGGEST ITEMS!!!   Take an order....anticipate needs...drink refills etc. CHECK BACK....is everything cooked properly????  Is everyone SATISFIED and happy....Wonderful.  THANK YOUR GUEST FOR THEIR BUSINESS....there are a ZILLION other places to eat especially in AZ!!  Let them know of other days specials...   GOOD GOD how does this not happen???   You know what this is???  Its called CUSTOMER SERVICE....and it separates the winners from the losers!  Good Luck!!

Best date night while in town. Amazing prices and even better food! Service was outstanding and the staff super-friendly. Margaritas were great, peel and eat shrimp were outstanding and the oysters with the atomic uber-good horseradish and beer battered fish tacos left us wanting more. Whenever we visit Gilbert we'll come visit!
This place was recommend think I expected better. I had the ahi tuna tacos and it was cold. Very bland tasting. The salsa really didn't have any flavor to it and margarita I've had better

Nothing So Cal about it.  Salsa tastes like it's shipped in from Idaho.  My homemade salsa is the bomb, and i found it insulting that you represent that salsa as So Cal.   I would never bring my friends from LA to this place.  Echhhh. The food is less than marginal, and I find it irritating to pay a high price for marginal food far from authentic.  If the food is excellent, I don't mind paying top dollar.  So Cal needs authenticity, better recipes, better menu and a few tips from us Southern Californians.  Get the fried fish out of there.  Where in California do they sell fish and chips in a Mexican food restaurant?  Definitely not in LA, which is my hometown.  Sorry, but I don't buy it.  Next stop, that other stupid "street taco" place that just opened up on Gilbert Rd  Get over yourselves....  Same review...less than marginal with crap for salsa.....

We made our first visit to SoCal Fish Taco Company today and had a fantastic lunch and great service! Our server, Mario, was attentive, engaging, and gave us a lot of background information about the history of the business, and made for a very enjoyable time. We were joined at lunch by friends who we hadn't seen for a while and spent about three hours with them, but never felt pressured to leave our patio table.

SoCal offers a great menu variety of fish & seafood tacos, and other seafood appetizers and meals. There were some delicious daily specials, craft beers, and very affordable prices. Everyone in our group agreed that we can't wait to return!

I had heard and read about how great this place was. Reality didn't match the hype. I had the calamari. It was okay and for $9, I expected a larger portion. The cod tacos were okay as well. A little too much breading. I will say the clam chowder was very good. My son had the fish and chips. He really liked it. Overall experience was okay; food was average and service was good. Id go back and try it again, but it is a bit over hyped.

We love Baja style fish tacos like you find in San Diego. This is the real deal. Wide variety of fish tacos are offered all very good. Fried shrimp is a light batter like you get on the Gulf Coast. Chowder is excellent.

I had the Maui and shark tacos with mango salsa. This place is awesome!!  I'm originally from Nebraska and found this place today. The management was awesome too!!  I had 30 in nutes before I had to be to work and I was in and out in 15 minutes and they are very busy! Price is awesome too. And I'm cheap!  $12 for two great sized tacos, rice, beans and a soda.
This place gets better every time we come.  Fresh ingredients, generous portions and a great vibe.  Try the beer battered lobster tacos if they have them. The salmon and Maui tacos are also a must.
Good service. I had the grouper which was good. My sister had the shrimp tacos which she enjoyed. The salsa was fantastic!
Got the Loco tacos. Not nearly enough seafood in the tacos and the beans and rice were in tiny side cups. Tasted good but not enough fish.

What a great find!  The food was good and the service was outstanding.  Very family friendly.  The entire staff was really attentive and nice. I went with my young nephew and little niece after a couple hours of play time. They were starving. The staff let us order while we waited for a table. They gave the kids a cold drink while waiting. I had the lobster tacos special and the kids each had mac n cheese and quesadilla (they call it crisp). We all three finished our plates. In the 30 minutes we were there. The server came by three times to check on us and to chat. The kids and I agree that we will be coming back.

Have been here a few times. Happy hour was great. Food is good beer prices ok. Waitress screwed up the 2 tabs that our party had. We told the waitress and she said even Pabs the owner could not fix them. My wife said you can go try.  The waitress responded "your not my mother". That was shocking but it gets better. The manager Matt corrected our tabs. Then we paid and he came back. Upon his return we asked him about the "mother" comment. His reply was that they see their staff as equals to the paying customers and the waitress felt insulted that we noticed she screwed up our tabs and requested that they be fixed. We were talking down to her and it was ok that she made the mother comment. Even my ultra relaxed friend (the owner of the other wrong tab) was pissed. It is the first time in my life that a manager of a restaurant told four of the seven people in the place he did not need their business. At that point I openly told Matt he sucked as a manager and we would not return. Matt must not know Slow Ride is across the street. It is rare that I get out to happy hour and get the wife to drive. Like Matt says our time and money are better spent across the street.

Went for lunch today.  Got there about 1pm, and was seated within 10 minutes.  Ordered 1/2 dozen oysters and a basket of clam strips.  Oysters were great!  being able to get fresh oysters in Gilbert is a great treat.  Now to the clam basket.  Should have known better, but it's just your standard frozen, chewy breaded clam strips.  They were also way over cooked.  Would be happy to pay more for freshly shucked fried clams.  

Will try tacos and steamers next time.
Great environment and outdoor seating these limited spring days. Wonderful service but mediocre food. Enjoy drinks but skip the bland food.

Just ate at So Cal fish tacos with my girlfriend. We both thought the tacos were excellent along with the sides of rice and beans. She had one complaint, which I didn't think about until she brought it up. From a purely recyclable point of view, it would be nice if not all of the food containers are throw away plastic. That being said, the place it great with a cool vibe.

Servers had poor manners when it comes to discussing internal business in front of the customers i.e. I don't want to hear how many tables they each have. The chowder was very good but the portion size of the entrees were so small I thought I must have ordered off the kids menu. The 2 pieces of beer battered cod were slightly bigger than the sad frozen refried French fries. For $8.not worth it. First and last visit.

Cute concept, but very mediocre. We went into this restaurant hoping to find some good mexican food in Gilbert, but were disappointed by the food. We ordered the fish taco, clam chowder, and oyster. The clam chowder and oyster were both below average. The oyster was warm and sort of gross. The clams in the chowder were chewy. The fish taco was average at best. Hard to justify eating here when Joyride is right across the street...
Love the food here! They buffalo style fried shrimp they have on happy hour is so good. Drinks are also good. Service is either hit or so-so. But I have yet to have a bad visit yet.

I love the food and I've eaten there frequently but I've found it's better to stick to to-go's. Everytime I've eaten in, the service isn't great. This last time I brought a group of friends, 5 total. 3 got there before the others and ordered chips and salsa, drinks and some tacos. They had to ask 4 times for the chips. Then when meals for all of us came, they brought them out two at a time. The 5th meal didn't come out for a full 15 minutes. My friend sat there waiting for her meal. Server wasn't attentive (we asked for napkins several times, drinks weren't refilled). Also, as we sat on patio, a busser went to take down an umbrella from a table to fit a larger party (push the tables together). He ended up hitting a lady at another table and we were ducking and moving out of the way. A guy at another table offered to help him but he said no and kept trying to move it. It was something out if a comedy routine (turn with a large item, people ducking under). 

They also seemed to have a problem with their phones for a while. Either it would be busy, or the call would disconnect after ringing a few times. They don't have a hold system as I called one time for an order and the server asked me to hold on. It was then obvious he just placed the phone down and I could hear everything going on. I stayed on the line for about 10 minutes and by then was in the area and just went in to place the order. When I walked in, the phone was still off the hook and now had the dial tone. So for at least 15 minutes no one would have been able to get through. 

So in short I love this place for the food, but there needs to be a lot more attention to the service and the ultimate atmosphere.

Between myself, friends and fianc√©, we've had a few of the tacos, appetizers, soup. Everything is pretty good. Tacos are awesome. The po boy sandwhich was literally a roll with a piece of fried fish on it. No sauces, nothing else. While presentation looked like it came from Denny's. It paled in comparison to tacos. 

2 stars for service. 4/5 for food.

Ugh! What a Friday night. 

I'll have to say this review is about the lack of customer service and the lack of compassion and not so much about the food as that was o.k.

My family and I came here for dinner on our way out I made the mistake of leaving my car keys on the table.  I recognize and understand that leaving my keys is my fault but a little bit of care, compassion, and understanding is something that any good business will provide to their customers  in order to keep clientele. Well what can I say unfortunately that was not the case at this locale the buss boy and manager were both on the defensive the entire time and offered no assistance what so ever on the contrary the manager accused me of saying something I did not say mind you there were 2 witnesses who heard what I indeed did say and can account for what was actuallu said. Then the manager went on to say because of what I supposedly said we no longer had the access to their trash can to see if our  keys  were thrown out mind you during our entire time there was no inappropriate language or accusations made on our end all we were wanting was a little help finding my keys instead I had to initially go through a trash can with no gloves because non were offered (mind you the manager was standing right next to me going through this can because he said he had to monitor me going through the can) finally after my husband complained gloves were brought out. Then we were given the bag of trash and were told we had to go dig through it by the dumpster and that was that they wiped there hands clean from the situation. 

I have never experienced such awful treatment from restaurant management needless to say we will never return to this place and would never recommend it to others.

So Cal catered our wedding! I love them and their food! Pablo and his buddy are the best! Next time, I need a caterer, they are it! Everybody loved their food! The Fish ceviche and shrimp tacos were the bomb! Thank you for a great experience SoCal!

I give them two stars because 1, the hostess was nice & 2, the decor was refreshing... 
Our waiter could have been friendly enough to deserve a bigger tip but at least he was attentive enough to refill our drinks a few times. 

For starters we ordered the $7 calamari fries. It was DELICIOUS. The pieces were thick and the batter was light enough. It came with a side of yummy aioli sauce & marinara, which I thought was a little odd.

I ordered the shrimp Po boy. It was disappointing. Three medium deep-fried shrimp with the tail still on, in between large pieces of white bread. Lettuce, onion & tomatoes came on the side. The tartar sauce was bland. The seasonless fries was the only good part of the dish. 

My other half ordered the fish and chips. It came with two medium size pieces of deep-fried cod and french fries. All you taste is the oil. That too was very disappointing.

If my commute wasn't  30 minutes away from Phoenix I would check out the happy hour since they do offer one dollar cod and tilapia tacos.

Best Fish Tacos around!!! owner is a true food fanatic and gets it as his family owns another High Quality Seafood Restaurant that has been around 25 plus years... Incredible Fish and Chips at a great price for a quick lunch!! best homemade cocktail sauce around!! great atmosphere and location!! always upbeat staff and treated very well and food is always prefect and ready to go on a phone call, walk in, or sit down meal!!! Highly recommended!!!! great chips and salsa and true  baja shrimp cocktails, along with a variety of other meals!!!!

My wife and I have been waiting for weeks for the So-Cal Fish Taco Company to open in downtown Gilbert. We are locals who frequent four great restaurants already in that section of town (e.g., Postino, Joe's B.B.Q., Oregano's, and Liberty Market).  

First impression matters: It was crowded on the first Friday night opening. We were told there was a one hour wait.  This helped us decide on takeout.  

The fish tacos were nice and crunchy, but we felt that there could have been more fish sauce & cotija cheese.

The carnitas tacos were a little dry to us.  The beans tasted as if they were canned beans.  In house cooked beans have a fresher taste to them.  

As Parents we were concerned that we didn't see a children's menu.  This could still be in the making, however.    

Service was fast for the to go order. Service was friendly. (Still finding their way in terms of organizing the crowd, but we think that is normal for a restaurant that has just opened.)  

We see this venue becoming a local favorite if they subscribe to the enduring idea that quality drives business and customer service matters.  

Haven't had the clam chowda yet but since we spent ten years in Boston we are ready to offer our thoughts after our next visit.
Really good food, but ridiculously small portions for the prices.  Even rice and beans come in little condiment dishes...
Always go get chips and salsa and they have great clam chowder soup and talipa fish tacos.

First visit to So-Cal, and loved it! We skipped the tacos on this first visit, and opted instead for the clam chowder, steamed clams, and crab cakes.  What a great choice we made, since all were outstanding.  Excellent beer list too.

We're originally from New England, and we've had hundreds of versions of clam chowder.  So-Cal's version is one of the best I've ever had.  The clams were perfect and not rubbery, the broth was just the right consistency, and the seasoning was spot on.  Amazing.

The steamed clams were brilliant.  It's easy to destroy the little gems, but So-Cal hit the nail on the head.  Sweet, succulent, and also cooked to perfection in a nice light buttery broth that did not over power the cherrystone size clams.

The crab cakes were full of crab, with just the right amount of well seasoned binding.  Outstanding.  

Now that we've savor end the "sides",  we'll be back soon to try the many versions of tacos, and other offerings that are sure to exceed our expectations.

GLAD YOU'RE IN TOWN, SO-CAL!!!!  What a great addition to historic downtown Gilbert.
Yummy food, good service, I usually get the fish and chips or the lobster tacos. I would recommend trying them out just once and you'll be hooked.
Awesome place. Patio is great. The owners are really nice and helpful. Just a good family owned restaurant and the food is amazing.

Been here a few times and the food is pretty good but the service today sucked. The server we had acted like we were a bother and he didn't follow up on the food. When the food came we were missing some simple sauces for my wife's tacos and we also asked for more napkins. After fifteen minutes I had to get up ad ask the manager if he could get it for is. Our server came out with like ten knack ins and dropped a small container of Baha sauce in the middle of the table and walked off. What an asshat. Won't be back. I'll make sure my friends no longer patronize this establishment either. Joyride is across the street and they have much better service not to mention food.

I absolutely love their fish tacos. In fact, I can't order them anywhere else now or I will be disappointed! The only drawback to this restaurant is that I have a small child and they have no changing table in the bathroom. I pointed this out to the owner and he said that they were going to get one, but as of now they still don't have one. This makes this a very unattractive choice for a place to eat in the summertime, as if I have to change a diaper, it's either do it in the restaurant or do it in a hot car. Both options are bad.

Went to So Cal Tacos for the first time today.  I ordered the Corona Beer Battered Mahi Tacos and my husband ordered the Tacos Locos. They were both delicious! The breading on the Mahi was light and crispy with an excellent flavor.  The tacos both came with a side of nicely seasoned rice and a side of beans.  The interior restaurant is small but friendly.   We sat in the covered outdoor patio area which offered a mist system and televisions.  Our waiter, Mario, was professional and very friendly.  He informed us that the fish is ordered from a Southern California distributor who is also a family member of the owner.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

We have been trying to branch out lately. I've really been into fish tacos so we thought we'd give them a try. 
When we walked in it took a little to be noticed. I'm used to being greeted right away and "I'll be with you" but that didn't happen. When we were greeted, they said to sit anywhere. 
Someone then brought us menus, and plastic forks. The plastic forks were placed right on top of the menu with no napkins.... That seemed unsanitary and really turned off my husband. 
We got the crab cakes and the beer battered mahi tacos. It states on the menu that you get beans and rice for sides. 
We waited a little but they were pretty busy so the wait was what was expected. When we got our food, we were both surprised by how tiny the sides were for the tacos! It was in a small cup the size of the cups you put ketchup or mustard in! 
Our waitress said she would bring us napkins, and never did. Again, it was busy... But still.
The crab cakes were good. Not anything special. The tarter sauce that came with it tasted like ranch dressing. Again nothing special. 
The fish tacos were bigger then most I've seen. They had an odd taste though. We think it may be the cheese they choose. 
At the end when we got our check and saw that for the small amount of food we got cost $20, we both decided we will not be going back based on the price for the quality and portion size.

This review is really not so much for the food but actually with our experience afterwards. I met my sister including her husband and the rest of my family. My sister and bro in law left their keys on top of the table, my mom and bro in law and I saw them unfortunately no one picked them up. We went across the street to liberty market to grab dessert. When my sister realized she had left her keys we returned to SoCal, the keys mysteriously not being their anymore. Mind you we searched our pockets, liberty market (btw shout out they were super helpful unlike SoCal), bags you name it. We went back a second time just in case, asked the management if they could possibly look through the regular garbage because there is a possibility that the key may have been thrown out. I have a lot experience in the restaurant and food service; I was a manager myself. I have seen this happen before myself unfortanutely, this is when all the problems started. 

I brought the situation to the bus boy. Right off the bat he had an extremely defensive, dissmissive and unhelpful attitude. All I had asked was if he had seen any keys and that they may POSSIBLY be in the garbage. Right off the bat he say "I'm not digging through the garbage and I didn't throw your keys". Then this punk just tell me "Well I'm just cleaning the table here" and just starts wiping down a perfectly clean table already and dismisses me. I have to ask this kid to get the manager when that should have been the case to begin with. 

Manager comes by gives nothing but excuses. He was ademant that someone walking by could have grabbed the keys (we were sitting outside). We explained that may have been a possibility BUT so could have someone accidentally thrown them in the garbage. My sister asked if the garbage can could be brought over just in case the keys could have been accidentally thrown away. This manager (unfortanutely I didn't catch his name) would not help and would not even bother to at least acknowledge what was going on. Sister starts digging through the garbage without gloves! 

The manager didn't even bother to stop my sister. He then directed all three of us to go to the dumpster for all three of is to dig through bags of garbage. This was after giving all three of us attitude for just trying to find the only set of keys to the car. I will say that it was understood by us that we as the party understand it was our fault for misplacing the keys. What was unnaceptable and definitely not appreciated was the defensive, dissmisive and lack of acknowledgement from the budget, waiter and staff and lack of help overall. My sister and brother in law had to end up towing their car. I will never come back to this place ever again.

So here we are in historic downtown Gilbert enjoying the magnificent day, in other words not too hot ;0)
Lines for every place to eat... Don't want to wait 30 for lunch. Cruised cross street and found this gem! I live in So Cal but do not have a place this tasty! The steamed muscles were amazing, fresh and sauce was top notch. The calamari strips were wonderful, tender and crunchy batter was lite. Also had oysters on half shell. Not from the day but still lovely. The sauce needed some flavor but they supplies extra horseradish for mixing.plenty of parking in back. Some seating inside and plenty in back outside. I would frequent this establishment if didn't take me 6.5 hours to get too!

My daughter, future daughter in law and I ate here for the first time. Pablo the owner was extremely knowledgeable and informative about all the items on the menu. We had for appetizers the clam chowder soup - fresh, filling and light. The flavors exploded in our mouth and I enjoyed the soup since it didn't feel like I was eating a ton of heavy cream which is sometimes all you can taste at other restaurants.  

We all LOVED the fact that you can order two types of different fish tacos if you want. It is very evident that Pablo wants his customers to be happy with what they order. We ordered swordfish tacos, beer battered lobster taco, and shrimp tacos - all were yummy! We thought the food was extremely fresh and flavorful.  In addition, we were able to substitute a side salad for the rice and beans. The salad had a fabulous lime Cesar dressing which was to die for.

We can't wait to eat here again. Service was outstanding, quick and friendly and food was delicious...what more do you want when you go out to eat!!! The prices were very reasonable too!

Was hungry for a fish taco, and went to yelp to search for the best. This place is fantastic. My wife had the fish and chips dinner, and I had the beer battered lobster taco. It was very very good. Servers were personable and attentive. Hats off, we will be back again. Five stars my review

Bill - Mesa Az.
Fish portions are much smaller than others I have had.  Only 1 tortilla?  Generally 2 is customary especially when you have sauces and salsa!  Flavor was ok.  Soup - chowder - was cold.

I'm not a huge fish taco fan. I do like the non fish tacos here as well as the side dishes. They usually have good beer also. Wouldn't be my first choice for tacos but the people I usually eat with enjoy the fish tacos and say they are the best around. I find the fish a bit fishy.

Cute taco restaurant in Gilbert. The decor & ambiance made me miss California! Service was good, they kindly accommodated our request to sit outside. Food was ok, pretty good but not too authentic tasting. I would love to try some other things on the menu!

Short & Sweet

Impeccable fresh oysters!
Great fried Shrimp!
Good beer.
Fresh, though simple salad.
Ask for your fries "well done".
I wish they had gelato for the perfect dessert.
Every things works at this place.  Service (Mario) was spot on and amazing.  Mango Margaritas out of this world. Oysters in the half shell sooo fresh.  This place is top notch.
The atmosphere was nice; we sat outside by a fire. The tacos were amazing! I highly recommend the tacos locos - delicious!

This is such a cool place! The ambiance is neat ... I felt like I was eating seafood in Southern California vs. Arizona.  I've never been to downtown Gilbert for dinner.  This was my first time and I really enjoyed it.  The weather was perfect over the weekend so after leaving the Harvest Festival in Chandler, we decided to head over to downtown Gilbert for diner.  While walking in downtown Gilbert we noticed the Happy Hour sign at SoCal so we (my partner and his 2 children) stopped in. 

We ate outside because the weather was perfect.  Inside was a little gloomy.  I ordered oysters on the half shell and clam chowder to start.  If you've read any of my previous reviews you'll see that I ALWAYS order oysters on the half shell and clam chowder for an appetizer if the restaurant has it.  No expectations here!  I went for it.  The oysters were pretty tasty but small.  They were blue point oysters for all my East Coast seafood lovers.  The clam chowder was more like clam soup instead of clam chowder.  It was thin and soupy but taste pretty darn good.  I like my clam chowder chunky and thick so although it taste good I wouldn't order it again.  I also order a Loca (grilled tilapia) taco and a Cod (fried fish) taco.  Both were really, really good!
My partner ordered the shrimp po' boy. I didn't try it but  he thoroughly enjoyed it.  Years ago I vowed to never try a Shrimp Po' Boy outside of New Orleans because every time I have they were just Blah.  

My partner however, loved it!  It's served with all of the fixings on the side so you sort of build your own Po'Boy.  He also ordered a Cod Taco and loved it.  The little one ordered chicken tenders, fries and mandarin oranges.  He quickly ate the fries and oranges and took a few bites of the chicken tenders.  HE said they tasted like fish sticks.  They looked like fish sticks for sure. I tried a small piece, the fish stick he taste was in the batter, meaning they fry the chicken tenders in the same grease as the fish.  It wasn't that big of a deal but it's an FYI for those with little ones. The really cool thing about the kids meal is the food is served on a Frisbee for keepsake.  We all thought that was a really nice touch!  Because I read a few yelp reviews while we waited for our food, I knew not to order any drinks.  Overall, I'd visit SoCal Fish Taco Company again for happy hour.
Food was good. Would go back. Thought was a little pricey for the amount of food. Had the lobster tacos, couldn't really taste lobster but was still good. The calamari fries are fantastic.

Absolutely the best Fish and Shrimp Tacos I've had. The Mexicali Shrimp Cocktail was exquisite! This isn't your normal American Shrimp Cocktail... It is a traditional Mexican style cocktail with shrimp broth, Clamato, chopped vegetables, avocados, served with a side of light flavored and salted chips. I also ordered the blackened grouper taco and the seasoned shrimp taco. Delicious! My wife had the fried fish which was cooked perfect too! Highly recommend but get there early because come Friday or the weekend around 4:30pm...it will be packed and you'll wait up to 2 hours for a table.

This place is so good! Service was great, love the decor, and the food tasted fresh. I got the shrimp po boy and the only thing it needed was the classic spicy mayo... Great back bone for something that is going to be a local favorite. Definitely coming here again and again!

The tacos were ok. Pretty small amount of tacos for a taco place. The rice they give u is so small, I was shocked. It is in a small condiment bowl. Their calamari fries are good but prob won't come back. Their prices are higher ESP for such small amount of food. I'm glad we tried it tho
Very good place for good tasty food. Beans and rice are ok but the tacos, tamale and salmon wraps are amazing

My husband and I went to SoCal for the first time and were greeted immediately and sat right away on the patio (at 5:30 on a Friday). We were approached right away and ordered the shrimp cocktail ($7). It came with 5 large shrimp on ice and was very fresh. The cocktail sauce had a tad too much horseradish for my taste but was still good. We weren't very hungry so we split the Mahi tacos (two for $7), but they were a pretty decent size, larger than street tacos. The fish was fresh and it came with a mango chutney, cotija cheese and some cabbage. They didn't over do the cabbage or toppings and the salsa that came on the side was delicious. Our server was prompt with the bill and we had an overall great experience. I hope they stay consistent and worthy of five stars!
Really good local place here in downtown Gilbert.   I had the Locos Tacos and it was really good.  I'd definitely recommend this place.  Service was great, too!

My husband and I were so disappointed in the tacos. Super plain and almost raw tortillas and the flavor was bland. We got the mahi and the grouper and both were not good. The price is affordable, but I would pay more for better flavor and quality somewhere else.
Great local joint that feels like part of the neighborhood, a very non-corporate vibe with good fish tacos!  My only setback is the lack of bar choices.
This was my first time here and will be back for sure.  great quick service.  Food was EXCELLENT!  I had the salmon and chicken wrap and it was off the charts good.
Great fish tacos and beer at a good price.  Nothing fancy,. But a great value and always good.   Nice back patio, with TVs and a mister and fans.

This place always delivers.   Food so fresh.  Service beyond amazing.  I have a hard time finding a place like this ten feet from the ocean and it's right here in Dunn Arizona.  The owner Pablo always greets me and he has a customer for life!

Probably some of the best ceviche I've had since I was in Mexico! My mouth is watering even writing this review. My friend and I shared ceviche and some Mahi tacos and everything was so delicious. The place is small but very welcoming. They have a nice sized outside eating area as well. I saw that they have some awesome looking happy hour deals that I can't wait to go experience :)
I was only impressed with the Seviche (hope i spelled that right). Other than that the place is more about the atmosphere than they are the food. The fish tacos were dry and lacking flavor.
Cozy taco shop in the heart of downtown Gilbert. The tacos here are fresh and tasty. While it wasn't too busy when we went so I can't really judge the service was great too!

Place was good. It's best to eat outside as the inside is quite small. Food came out quick and the service was good. Only thing holding back from a five star is I could hear the employees from around the corner talking bad about guests that were sitting outside. I'm not sure what those guests but they ended up switching servers for that table. The team continued talking about that table for a good 20 minutes as we were eating.
Great food, service and atmosphere.  I had the salmon tacos and daughter had tortilla soup. Glad we tried it out. When it's cooler out we'll sit outside.

Great happy hour Mon-Thurs from 3-6pm! Tacos average $2. I got the chicken and tilapia tacos, both were delicious but not to be outshined by the fish ceviche tostada for $2.50! Everything tastes remarkably fresh. 

Love the decor and outdoor patio. For a little while,  I forgot I lived in Arizona. I felt like I was eating at a establishment near the beach in California.

After spending a week in San Diego I had some of the BEST shrimp tacos. And since then I have been constantly craving them, so my boyfriend and I came here hoping they might satisfy that craving. Well we were wrong.

We walked in and were instantly greeted, the host/ waiter told us there was gonna be quiet a wait for inside but they did a small bar to sit us at or we could sit outside. Not really wanting to be in the heat we opted to sit at the small "bar". That small bar was right behind the host counter, the waiter then told us this was actually and additional waiting area for customers. We sat there for not even a minuet before we asked if we could move outside. The "bar" was such a confined space we could barely sit comfortably. The waiter happily obliged, then took us to the patio.

While the patio was hot, it wasn't unbearable with the umbrella, misters, and fans. After over looking the menu, I decided on the shrimp tacos, and he the ahi tuna. They came out fairly quick, which was nice. But the tacos were nothing great. My tortillas were cold, like out of the fridge cold. There wasn't much flavor at all on the shrimp. The rice was white, which was odd, the beans were straight out of the can. What was really unfortunate was the fact the shrimp in my tacos still had a lot of the shell on them. Each bite I was pulling shell out of my mouth, my boyfriends tuna was almost all chewy, and uneatable. 

Needless to say, we won't be going back. There was nothing to bring me back to try their food again. Especially with the subpar service.
Love this place! Great service and good food. Another great "spot" in downtown Gilbert.

Awesome little find. Cute and very clean. SoCal Fish Taco Company has a great patio area, inside it pretty small only about eight tables. You will definitely get that California beach feel here. Service was attentive and friendly. Alicia suggested the Corona Beer Battered Tacos served with beans and rice all tasted great. Portion size was perfect. She also suggested the Tangerine Wheat Beer tasted like a orange soda. We also tried the Mexicali Shrimp Cocktail lots of flavor.

I'm not sure the hype here although admittedly I'm not a fish taco fanboy. The food was good, but I felt a bit expensive. If I want tacos I'd much rather go to Fuzzy's on Mill - bigger portions for less money. Nothing on the menu jumped out me here but I got the beer battered mahi tacos. Beans were awesome. GF got a vegetarian taco and wasn't impressed at all.

On a side note there was a guy there who I'd assume was the owner. While he didn't talk to me, he seemed like a dick.

OMG!!! How on earth have my wife and I not been here before? By far the best fish tacos, and tortilla soup we have EVER had!!! It is truly amazing. It's hard to believe it's only been around since 2013, as it has an amazing established feel about it. Oh, don't let me forget about the rice, for once a Spanish/Mexican rice that is truly fantastic. The beer battered tacos were so fresh, and juicy!!!
We have been to all the other restaurants in the heritage district, and this is the jewel of them all!!!
Don't hesitate to stop by this amazing restaurant!!!!

So-cal fish Co is a super cute downtown Gilbert restaurant! I have to firstly admit what a great job they did on the design, I literally felt like I was back in Southern California on their back patio. This back patio is perfect for enjoying some cold west coast beer, fresh fish tacos and juicy oysters. The service is great and all the staff were friendly and knowledgable. Our server happened to be the nephew of the owner who told us that his grandfather owns the Seafood Market Restaurant on baseline in Mesa. He told us how hard they work to get in the freshest  seafood in Phoenix and I can tell you that both the fish tacos and oysters were superbly delicious and great tasting. I had never heard of the Seafood Market but I am definitely planning on checking it out soon. But if your in downtown Gilbert this is a great place to go to.

Excellent fish tacos, and quick service for take out.  Reasonable prices, and great variety on the menu.  Only 4 stars because they're closed on Sundays, and because the carne asada was only average.  It seems like the carne asada, chicken, and carnitas are only on the menu to provide variety.  Their real specialty is the various fish tacos (cod, grouper, mahi, salmon, etc), so if you go for those, you won't go wrong.

So-Cal is good! They have a huge outdoor patio and limited inside seating (which is probably bad for them with the extreme heat right now!). But the patio rocks any other time! And it's in the back so you don't have the busy Gilbert Rd traffic noise. 
The food is reasonably priced. I like the fried clams, fries and coleslaw. My husband likes the fish tacos. 
We love the little coronitas buckets. 
It's cute and a great addition to DT Gilbert. We are frequent lunch customers.

The food here is really good. There is a focus on atmosphere here, which pays itself off when combined with solid food offerings.

Where So-Cal Fish Taco Company shines is how it prepares its dish, clearly doing the research on tasting. The tacos are delightful, the flavors a journey of its own. The initial bite has you tasting well-marinated fish and the finish has you tasting the kick of well-mixed homemade salsa.

Service was rad, attentive, yet non-intrusive. Drinks were to be expected of a low-key seafood place with hipster music playing in the background.

Why dock a star then?

PORTIONS. Oh man, how small the portions were. If you're shelling out over $10 for a plate of tacos, do you really expect only two little tiny tacos? Man, if the flavors weren't good, I'd bring the review down to 3 stars. 

Keep this in mind, I'm going to keep the negatives short on this review, but just note that if you were in Seattle, $12 for a plate of tacos would go MUCH further for the portions you get.
Loved the Mahi tacos. Not a huge indoor seating area, but worth the wait. Or sit outside. Great atmosphere. Cold beer from So-Cal breweries.

We started with coconut shrimp and wow the flavor was magnificent. I also had a cup of the clam chowder and it was one of the best I've had. My wife got the tequila shrimp tacos and I got the blackened grouper. I cannot wait to go back.

The SoCal Fish Taco Company has been hit or miss for me and the reason I say this is because there are several locations. The one I am particularly reviewing is the Redlands location. The setting is nice and there are usually lots of people in there but the last couple times that I have been in, my food has been quiet disgusting. My plate had water standing on it in what seemed like a quarter inch thick, it was pretty sick. I made sense of it in my mind because the grilled zucchini that comes with it could have been the reason but the more that I thought about, I couldn't justify that much water and feel like I could have done a better job cooking it myself. Other times, I couldn't order a certain menu item because they were sold out but no one thought to say anything until I waited in line for 20 minutes and got to the register to order and After making my order, they told me they were sold out. Just take it off the menu! The nice part was that the fish has always been cooked great, and the ambiance has always been nice. Lets work on the rest and I think they would have something special here. 

Thanks, 
MLA
Calamari fries are amazing, but so is just about everything I've tried. This place is truly a gem and the staff is pretty awesome too. Just do it.
Didn't think it was that great. Over priced even for downtown Gilbert. Went by the owner but he didn't say anything or acknowledge.  I guess they don't need the repeat business.  Won't be back

It looks like a nice place but I would not go back. The tortilla soup was good but tacos are not anything special. My husband said I make better ones at home. But the real issue I have with this place was the kids food. They serve the adults fresh food but all the kids food is from the freezer. I was very annoyed when my daughter ordered fish and chips and ended up with something that came from a freezer. I want my kids to eat fresh food, none of that freezer crap. I don't buy it from the grocery store, I certainly don't want it at a restaurant.

Gilbert really needs a great fish taco.. And this is it. I can't stop thinking about the calamari appetizer and fish n' chips entree (with the yummy dips) we enjoyed last week. Perfectly crunchiness and flakey meat on the inside of the cod. Temperature of food was piping hot and seasoning was spot on.

Staff was friendly and fairly attentive. Very cool patio furniture, lighting, but misters were a bit too powerful and got us more wet than we wanted. The price was not bad, it was $20 for an app and entree and we gobbled up every last delicious bite that we could muster. Definite return.
Delicious food, staff is always pleasant. I like craft beer and feel like they try to have a good selection of California craft beers on-hand. Haven't had a bad meal yet.
Fun outside patio. Super friendly staff. Clam chowder bread bowl is delicious! Ask for John...fun and attentive server!

Love coming here for my fish taco, fried clam fix.  The fried clams are just so good, not all batter and its a big order.  I also ordered the fish sandwich this past visit.  It was HUGE! It can be shared with another person for sure.  The fish tacos, shrimp tacos are excellent and the staff is really nice.  Dining inside is sometimes hard because it is a small space, but worth the wait.  They have a nice patio with a fan and misting system, so its not to bad to sit outside.  They also serve alcohol, I tried the sangria but didnt care for it.
This was decent. Definitely not a good spot for taco tuesday.  The tacos were good,  the crab cakes tasted like hush puppies, and the food was overpriced. All and all, we won't be back.

Great place for a decently priced, and light lunch.  Fish tacos are very delicious.  This is a new favorite lunch spot and I can't wait to go when it cools down and sit on the large patio and have a cold beer.

It was a quaint little outdoor seating type restaurant, busy and luvrly- in downtwn Gilbert. I had the ceviche, it was good. Prices were decent and it was clean, but restaurant was tight inside and outdoor seating was loud with car noises since it back into parking lot. If you enjoy seafood it's good fare and variety but not fresh from the ocean type. It was clean and waiter was funny and flamboyant. I enjoyed hid funnies than the food and crowd for sure.

So as soon as we were greeted,  I guess I started getting a little annoyed.  We waited for about 25 mins and in that time frame another family waited to be seated and then a couple came in about 15 mins later waiting to be seated.  A server immediately asked if the couple wanted to order drinks,  but never asked our family or the other family. Boy did I get thirsty in that time frame! After we were seated, Haley greeted us pretty quickly & we received drinks pretty fast as well. She asked if we were ready to order which we weren't,  but then she didn't return for quite a while & we saw that it seemed she was taking a break with another server.  When she did return,  I specifically said that my husband & I would be getting an appetizer,  but to not hold up the kids food order. That didn't happen.  We got our appetizer, & then about 10 minutes later,  the rest of the food came out.  I also asked her to put my stepson's sauce on the side so he could try it & she said OK.  When we didn't get the sauce,  I asked her to bring it. I also told her I got the wrong fish taco, she replied,  "you ordered the mahi". I said "yes,  but I wanted the beer battered". Her next reply,  "yeah,  but you just said mahi, not battered". (Shouldn't that be her job to ask?  I mean,  she should know the menu better than me right? ) apparently it was my fault because she assumed I wanted them broiled. I also asked for the fish taco meal (2 tacos) and a Carne asada taco on the side. I received one of each. When I told her I didn't get the other fish and it was supposed to be battered, that's when the fish discussion happened. Oh & to top it off,  the kids menu specifically says it comes with mandarin oranges, not the canned pineapple they gave my daughter, but never mentioned they'd be substituting. She hates pineapple btw, but loves mandarins. The bill comes & we see she had charged us for the fish meal & a fish taco on the side.  Should have been a fish meal & a Carne asada taco.  That would have been the way I ordered it & the least expensive. She even charged us for the sauce that came with my stepson's taco but we asked to put on the side. She also charged for extra carne when my other stepson asked for half chicken half steak instead of one or the other. He didn't get extra meat! Just half of each, so why did we get charged extra?! By this point I was too irritated to complain again, so we just paid the bill and left.  On another note,  I feel it's very inappropriate for an employee/manager to smoke & drink on the premises, in front of patrons, when wearing the uniform (t-shirt with logo). And the guy who originally told us to sit down & when he got a table he would seat us, did just this. I believe another employee referred to him as Pablo. We gave this place a try,  but we won't be back.  Aside from the service, the food was just mediocre. The Carne asada tasted as if it had been cut from a roast beef & the rice tasted like it came from a box. The best part was the "battered" Mahi. (Ah Ha! I said it right this time!)

I ordered battered mahi mahi taco plate with no beans just rice. Tacos were very tasty (or I should say the fish was flavorful) and the cotija cheese on top created this wonderful aroma. Cabbage was fresh and crispy. Their salsa was nothing but bland. Very few Taco joints take pride and go an extra mile by making great flavorful salsas. I had to get some chalula to make it spicy. Anyway I sat in the backyard patio. It was extremely hot that day but the huge shade with mist system made the heat go away. Long story short, a decent fish taco and I would like to try more stuff in the menu next time.

My family and I live just down the road in Gilbert and were super excited to see a new restaurant open up in down town Gilbert. We waited about a week after the location opened before stopping by to escape the "grand opening" rush.  We went in early on a Friday night - probably about 5:30 and we just beat the rush. We were immediately seated and offered drinks.  Now please not the seating in this location is pretty sparse unless you are willing to sit outside.  Nice patio seating, but in AZ in the summer I can't do it with young kiddos. Young servers that are nice, but inexperienced and it shows.

We placed our orders and started with the calamari appetizer - I love calamari - but this was kind of a let down. It was okay, but honestly Oregano's calamari is ten times better. So next up we ordered the kids fish and chips, my oldest had the garlic clam appetizer, hubby had the fish and chips and I had the fish tacos (don't recall which kind).  Everything was okay but not great, and portions were so so.  The clams were really good, but half weren't open so not a great deal for the money.  I was still hungry from our order so we decided to try the crab cakes to finish and this was by far the worst. They were gross and mushy with no texture - it kind of tasted like crab straight from the can - other than the crispy outside, no texture and no crab taste at all.

I was really hoping for a great new restaurant when we walked in - at this point I wouldn't return because it really was just OK.

My go to in Downtown Gilbert. The closest place I can find to "the real deal" and not being in Cali on the beach. Always fresh. Always good. And staff and ownership are always attentive alert and remember me. Thanks.

The food was fantastic, very Baja Cali style but so tasty. The beers were ehh and the servers were friendly. Just a little pretentious...just a little. But seriously who cares with food that great. I would go during the day next time Bc the restaurant is as dim as a Hollister store and doesn't feel that inviting. But I'll def go there again.
Great healthy prepared fish tacos . No greasy like Rubios. Portions are ideal. We will be revisiting this fine establishment soon.

Wowwwww! Enjoyed every single bite  Met my son for lunch, neither of us had ever been here before and so glad we decided to try this place out. I had the Corona battered Mahi and he had the broiled Shark tacos and clam chowder. If you haven't tried this place out, I HIGHLY recommend it! Trust me you wont be disappointed. Mario was our server and I'd like to give him a shout out because he was a great! Thank you Mario for the awesome service
Great seafood and service! I dont leave reviews unless they justify my time. So Cal fits the bill. Good prices and nice ambience.

My husband and I went to SoCal Fish last night.  We had a great experience from the friendly employees to the delicious food.  The decor is super fun and cool.  Everything looked clean and well maintained.  Our waitress Jackie was very helpful in helping us choose a beer and tacos.  We started with the best calamari fries we've ever had, tortilla soup and ceviche tacos.  The ceviche was so amazing! For dinner, we had lobster tacos, the special of the month, and the seared ahi tuna salad with the sesame dressing.  Both were exceptional!  We had such a great experience! The place was packed and everyone was hustling.  The patio had a bunch of heaters but I was chilly sitting inside as both the doors were open.  Just bring a sweater.  All in all, we can't wait to go back and bring our three kids or visitors when they are in town.  Wish this place was closer to our house, like in Chandler:)
SoCal fish taco is absolutely delicious and reasonably priced! I also love being able to get Coronado Brewing beer here. The ceviche is to die for!

This place is so delicious! It's small but very nice! Love it! First we ordered the calamari for an appetizer!!! Perfectly done and not chewy!! I ordered the mahi mahi tacos with mango salsa! Loved it! Rice and beans were good too! My husband ordered reg cod tacos and he said it was really good! My daughter got fish and chips and loved it! Overall this place was great! We will definitely be back and highly recommend this place!

I'll be coming back to this place.  The menu has so many good choices. The inside seating is small but adequate for lunch. The outside back patio is pretty large for bigger groups. I had oysters on the half shell and fish & chips.  Both were fantastic. You should eat here. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the lighting. It's a little dim IMO but not something that will keep me from eating here.

This place definitely stands out among the menagerie of the Heritage District, which has given way to subpar food and terrible service/wait times. It's now my top choice for tacos in the area!

My mom and I came in on a slightly busy weekday evening and were promptly greeted and seated! Both of us were impressed by the fast and attentive service. Our food took no time at all and the portions were perfect. My mom got fish tacos and I the carne asada tacos. We were both very pleased and can't wait to come back!
Just ok. Fish was a bit lack luster in flavor.  Cute place but the food did not impress us.

I had the two pc cod beer batter fish and chips. I dont usually buy beer battered fish. 

In my experience you usually get more batter than fish. However, at SoCal, the fish is lightly battered thus you can taste the fish which was pretty good. 

For $8.50 you get two reasonable pieces of fish and an average portion of fries. Another pc of fish and larger portion of fries would have push the rating to 5 stars.

I also had the New England style clam chowder which I liked. The chowder was just right. Not too thin and not too thick. You can actually taste the flavor of clams and not a bunch of salt, which many restaurants add to mask the flavor.

Another reason for the 4 stars; Indoor seating is very small. Feels like your sitting in narrow hallway with tables. They did have outdoor seating which we will try next time. 

Service was excellent and in a category by itself, deserves 5 stars.

Friendly staff, decently priced seafood options and yummy tacos. The chips and salsa were good and pretty spicy, so take caution if you're not very good with spicy food. The calamari fries were good but wish there were more than 8 pieces. And it was nice having refills and drinks to take to-go. Downside would be just not enough room inside for seating.
The fish tacos here are incredible. The carnitas tacos are delicious as well. We got the ceviche to start which was just okay, but the tacos more than made up for it. I'll definitely be coming back.

Love the fish tacos!! Almost every me has been amazing. My hubbys swordfish wasn't too fresh tasting today but the mahi mahi, shrimp, and any other taco has been tasty. The shrimp ceviche tostadas are delish.

It's very small. But people are in and out. The staff is always really nice. Highly recommend!!

We've lived in Gilbert for about 2 1/2 years and only last weekend finally decided to stop by instead of Joyride (and we love Joyride!).  So worth it.  So-Cal is a mom & pop shop, friendly staff, specializes in fish tacos (duh) with the most amazing clam chowder to taste!

There's a cozy outdoor patio with maybe 10 tables inside.  Definitely a perfect lunch spot!  I think they're looking into expanding their hours or having outdoor seating only when the new bars start popping out and hopefully more people will get the chance to taste the deliciousness!

Went twice. First time food was good. 2nd time, ordered Oysters again, Served on iceless tray with one piece of lemon and one piece of lime for a dozen oysters. Blackened grouper is really grouper with a spicy seasoning sprinkled after it is cooked. Maybe don't call it blackened. 

Both times, the service was terrible. Very long wait to take our order, then someone else delivers the food. The servers could use some training in order to keep things going. Both times, even though there was a 25 minute wait for tables, we waited over 15 minutes for someone to bring a check. Wishing them luck and will try again.
Amazing gourmet tacos at non-gourmet price. Great patio and service. Beer selection limited but cool breweries. Definitely coming back.

Crab cakes....fantastic! My only knocks at this place are that they do not have Guacamole (for things other than fish tacos) and that the scallops were a tad over cooked. BUT, I can look past this as the food, atmosphere and staff are awesome and overall this a great place to go! I recommend the Crab Cakes, shrimp tacos, chicken quesadilla with Baja sauce.

Food was very good and prepared from scratch. The calamari was outstanding   The batter was light and the sticks  were not something I had seen before. They were plump and the calamari was very very tender. Not a bit chewy. Wife had chicken tacos. She said they very good. They have a small selection of craft beers. Service was good. Will be back to try some other items.

The atmosphere is cute, and overall a good location. I went here a couple days ago and ordered the cod with fries. The pricing seemed competitive, however, the food didn't wow me. It was alright though.

Really great tacos! The fish was really fresh tasting. Loved the sides. Service was excellent (Josh)! I loved sitting on the patio,  it was a wonderful atmosphere.  Sangria was delicious.  We will definitely be back soon.

Sooooo GOOD! Mahi Maji tacos were flavorful with an abundance of tender meat and fresh veggies. The mango salsa was perfect. My friend loved her Tilapia tacos and calamari fries. Sauces and salsas were all very tasty. We came in close to closing but the waiter was still friendly and helpful. I'll definitely be back!

My son and I run over her on "Mom's not home" nights... it's quick, clean and delicious.  He's training and feels no guilt on these dishes.

The patio is welcoming and lots of people interacting.  It may be a half block south of the center of the Heritage District, but it's worth it.  Parking is really easy too.

I suggest going all out on the burritos!
This place was seriously awesome! I love the vibe of the joint and the tacos were great! I absolutely loved the pinto beans that came on the side also :)

The food isn't good, the portions are small, and the niche they're trying to fill is just confusing. Figure a place with a name containing the words "SoCal" and "tacos" would be moderately Mexican? Rookie mistake. Don't believe me? They serve french fries, clam chowder, and fish n' chips. No salsa bar. Everything is really wheat-based, including their sides of bread. It's like some English or Italians immigrants moved to California and started calling everything they made Mexican because they felt like it. But it's not even decent. My french fries tasted more like oily potatoes. I finally had to stop eating in Gilbert. These people must be incredibly hungry all the time because virtually all the best rated Yelp places in Gilbert are awful.
Outdoor seating was very nice. Service excellent. The tacos were very good and so was the salmon wrap. Yum!!
Great food, great service, and super chill environment.  It's a very casual place, so they do serve your food on paper plates.

We have been coming to SoCal for a few years. It's a favorite in my house. Our favorite is the lobster tacos, I highly recommend these. The outdoor patio is large shaded. The only down fall is there is very limited indoor seating, so it's not the best place to visit in the middle of a hot summer day. But it's not too bad in the evening during summer as they have fans and shade on the patio.

After spending an extended period of time in Mexico, I was struggling to find a fish taco quality in Phoenix that was similiar to what I enjoyed South of the border. The Cod Fish Tacos at So Cal Taco were great !! After eating many Cod FT in the past, the quality of the fish they use is excellent, above par from other local FT places. The Baja Sauce they offer is good, however there was not enough on each taco for my liking. I ordered extra and they were great. The only negative comment I would have would be that they do not offer a spicy salsa. I used my own spicy salsa, which offsets the creamy Baja sauce they offer. So Cal Taco is a WINNER, but PLEASE get a Salsa option with some heat.
UPDATE - Determined they DO have a spicy salsa, however must be requested. This being discovered, SO CAL is THE place in the East Valley for Fish Tacos !!
I absolutely love this place. I come here like twice a week. Love the Shrimp platter!

So I was expecting the food to taste like any other fish shack in the valley. Boy was I wrong. We started out with the crab cakes. They had good flavor & a nice crunchy exterior. The cocktail sauce was the best part. I order the tamale del mar for my entr√©e. Folks, that dish is awesome. The seafood in it was cooked right. It was a perfect dish. My wife had the cod tacos. #amazing. Plenty of fish. It wasn't overwhelmed with batter or coleslaw. We also ordered the three street taco plate. Good, but not my favorite. Cole loved them. We sat outside and it was a beautiful night to have fish tacos, a cold beer & the love of my life. I'll definitely be back. This might be our new favorite hang out.

Calamari fries are phenomenal and the tacos, beans and rice are delicious.  Our server, Brittany, was attentive, knowledgeable of the menu and had excellent social skills.

The prices are a bargain in my opinion ($9 for two fish tacos with rice and beans).  The atmosphere is laid back and fun.  I think we found our new favorite place in downtown Gilbert.

3 stars for now. Went for lunch. Clam strips were awesome !  Lightly battered n crunchy. Cod tacos were a bit dry. Queso fresco was good but they needed more sauce. The place has a nice vibe. I'll try it again if I'm in the area.

Very good food and excellent salsa (odd, right?) You definitely feel as if you are in southern cal at this spot. Staff is friendly and the food is moderately priced. Overall, one of the restaurants that will be in our rotation as a lunch spot

Had a good dinner here tonight. First time here for dinner, and it had been a couple years since I was here for lunch one day. When you walk in, it feels like you are suppose to wait to be seated, but we waited and no one came. Apparently you seat yourself.

They seemed short staffed.

However, the food was really good and the atmosphere was awesome.

I'll definitely give them another try in the future.

I have been wanting to try this place for awhile, but find myself in the area during times they're closed. They are closed ALL DAY Sundays. Finally, crossed this off my list, sovhere it goes...
I liked the food, loved the outdoor patio with a fireplace and lots heating lamps. The vibe is SoCal surfer and they have a decent drink menu. Missed Happy Hour, which I regret since a la carte tacos are just $1.50. Darn. 

Had oysters and they were fresh enough, liked that the horseradish had lots of kick. Mahi Mahi tacos were good. Rice was ok, kind of dry.
