I had a couple of petrified rice kernels that I bit into a few times, so I'm not sure if they're dried out from sitting all day, or what. The beans were great, stayed warm in the styrofoam cup throughout the entire meal. Ordered churros for dessert, and they were hot, soft-crunchy, and came with a caramel dipping sauce that was perfect. The churros stole the show! Try them!

Service here is friendly enough. My pet peeve at any restaurant is not having condiments at my table. I had to ask twice for hot sauce. A taco shop should automatically have hot sauce brought to the table, just like if you were at a burger joint, they bring ketchup out prior to your plate coming out. 

Ambiance, food, and service was good, but I think they have untapped potential to be great in the heart of Downtown Gilbert. And I really wish they were open Sundays. I'd give another star if they were! I struggled between a 3 or 4 star rating. 3.5/5 is more accurate, but I'm willing to go back and try this place again and I'll update my review prn.
It was ok. Ordered Olvera st. Tacos, tortillas were served cold. Clam chowder could have used a bit more clam and chowder little less soup.
Gave this place another shot and once again the employees were total douche bags; We will not be back!

Simple, neat food without trying to overdo the atmosphere. Tilapia tacos had a nice large filet, broiled, not breaded. One of our party reported these are better (and much less expensive) than other fish tacos nearby. Quick, clean service, great price!! Will definitely dine again.
Great servers... Very decent prices... Had clam chowder which was real treat... Fish and chips were pretty good... Would definitely come back..

Horrible Experience! The first time I came in there me and the bf didn't know what to order we wanted fish tacos we told the waitress, so we order this combo plate. 5 mins later our waitress tells us there is happy hour at 6 and fish tacos are one dollar. um you couldnt of told us to wait five mins? The soup I ordered had something metal in it, actually swallowed it! A small Soda was $2.50 little much since half of it was ice. Every time after that that I came I never had a good experience; food took forever, bad bad customer service. I gave up on this place!!

I feel like I'm in SoCal...not really.

Their alfresco seating in the back was perfect for this time of the year.  Indoors was a little cramped, but very nicely decorated.  Since fish tacos are their specialty, I had the blackened grouper topped with slaw and cotija cheese.  The fish could've used a little bit more flavor or spice.  I was happy with their corn tortilla which single handedly kept all of the fillings from spilling out.  The house made sangria was not bad.  Carne asada, as usual, for the hubby with ice cold Mission Ale.  He said it also needed a little bit more zing.   I also wanted to try the clam chowder.  Just little too much thickener for my taste with cornstarch or flour but the taste is there with chunks of clams.  My little cutie pie had the popcorn shrimp and fries he raved about.  The portion was pretty big for a kids meal ($5) that came with a drink,

So far, we enjoyed the food offered at such an awesome price.  I'm glad this one is not too far to frequent!  We'll be back for sure!

My husband and I tried this place for the first time last night and was pleasantly surprised with the food.  The shrimp tacos and blackened grouper tacos are delicious!   Their staff and the atmosphere is fantastic.    
We will be going back and taking others with us.

This place is awesome. Great tacos, super reasonable, and nice adult beverage selection. They have several craft beers, which is a nice touch for my main squeeze. The cod tacos are super yummy.. They have great happy hr deals too. Only crappy thing is that it's only offered Monday-Thursday. But, great little patio.. And every time I have been, the service was very laid back and friendly.

I am one positive person my husband and I received the worst service here ever. 1st they completely forgot to about us and 10 minutes later I found someone and informed them no one has come to our table. They looked completely lost and just did there looking at me. Till I said is someone going to serve us then they stood around looking dumb found and finally founded someone to serve us. They forgot to give us the complementary chips and salsa the food was OK deafly not worth the price. Then when it comes down for us to get our bill they give us the completely wrong bill to add the cherry on top and nobody said bye to us when we left. I would rate the food a 3 1/2 but the service was absolutely horrendous.

SoCal fish company specializes in fish tacos. The restaurant is small inside with seven or eight tables and is nicely decorated with a surfboard and  surfing pictures on the wall. The restaurant is sit down and I believe they may do more business if they had a counter you could order at -it may be quicker. But with that said I was in and out of there within 25 minutes. I ordered the Mahi fish tacos and they were excellently prepared. The fish was perfectly cooked and the tacos had cabbage and a mango salsa over the top. The tacos cost seven dollars and they came with a side of beans which had a nice spicy kick and rice - when you combined them it made a really nice side dish. The tacos were a nice size and it was a very satisfying lunch. I had a ice tea with my meal and the server refilled my ice tea and promptly cashed me out. Although the inside was relatively small there is a nice patio out back that has another 12 tables and also a nice comfy couch area to relax in and to eat your tacos - they also have a mister system out there to cool things off on the patio. I also saw that for dessert they have a delicious looking cookie ice cream sandwich that I will have to try next time. SoCal fish is a nice addition to downtown Gilbert and I will definitely will be returning.

Really did not like this place.  

The atmosphere was good, and the decorations and simple menus were nice.  

The food itself was not that appetizing.  It was all very crisp and fresh.  However, it lacked flavor and was kind of bland.  Though I do have to admit this is good in away because it means the food isn't overloaded with salt or other unhealthy items.

I the mini tacos.  And they were wet.  So wet the tortillas were falling apart in my hand.  And I felt like a faucet was turned on, running down my arm, to my elbow, and onto the floor.

Needed to order extra stuff as they were also pretty small and unfulfilling.

Love this place. It's nearby, so my husband and I eat here every couple of weeks. Today I tried the shrimp bowl, which was super tasty, and my hubby had the salmon and shrimp wrap. I usually eat the lobster tacos, which keep me coming back. Kudos also to Baylee, who always ends up as our server. He's very knowledgeable about all the food and drink options, and is  always on top of things like drink refills or the check. We'll definitely be coming back again!
Very Fresh Fish Tacos, my kids also enjoyed the fish and chips and carne asada quesadilla. I love the California beer selection. It felt like being in San Diego again

Ugh. I didn't want to do this but wow... disappointing. First off, service was GREAT! Food was blah. I ordered some (highly recommended by the server and host) new tacos locos.  They were supposed to have mahi, scallops and shrimp with peppers and other stuff in a wine reduction sauce. Hmmm... mostly.cabbage and one had a shrimp and the other had a small chunk of fish and a scallop the size of a pencil eraser. Literally. The two teaspoons of rice needed to cook for another half hour and the beans were bland. Oh and get this!!! I got a margarita and the bartender literally poured from a pre-mixed bottle --- $7 margarita that came from a $10 bottle from bashas. Husband enjoyed the clam chowder, kid #1 thought his quest quesadilla was "ok" but fries were hard and kid #2 thought the mac n cheese was horrible (and he eats anything). 
Did I mention the calamari fries are delightful? That's where the three stars came from... maybe should've been two.

We love that this place has come to our town. The fish and chips are yummy and my husband and son both love their fish tacos. And the crab cakes are wicked good! Relaxing patio out back away from the main street and they even have my fave Coronado Brewing Co. Orange Ave. wit. YAY!  We'll keep coming back.

We were eager to try So-Cal, so last night was the night. Maybe we expected to much from a restaurant that says they " want to give you food that you can get stoked about". 

Ok, it started out good. We got the Oysters on the half shell and some of the Mission Brewery Hefeweizen. The Oysters were fresh and very tasty. The beer, cold and refreshing.

I ordered the mahi tacos, and my husband ordered the shrimp tacos. With each bite we kept saying to each other, is this it? We came here for this? We waited 30 minutes for this?  The tacos did not have much flavor. Tacos from Rubio's taste much better. The beans tasted as if they were out of a can, and whats with white rice with tacos? Is that what they do in So-Cal ?

Maybe the cooks were a little to much in a "California State Of Mind" last night, and forgot the seasonings on the fish.

This place rocks and I love everything about it! I am so excited to have something local and great food that saves me a drive to California! The tacos are awesome and they are so fresh and delicious. I think this place is better than the other similar restaurants in the surrounding area. It's a wonderful place that is kinda hard to get to but is worth it when you get great fish and chips which my toddler loves! I like the shrimp, pork, or chicken tacos. My husband loves the grouper, beef and pretty much everything on the menu! I haven't tried the calamari fries yet but I'm going to the next time we go. We go here at least once every month and would go more if we could. This place is our go to place when we are visiting relatives in Gilbert and any time we need a taco fix!
This place is my new fav spot ! Everything was delish & my ill boys loved it too! Great atmosphere for everyone, very clean and friendly staff. Thx So.Cal fish Co. ;)
One of my favorites.  I love seafood tacos and So-Cal offers some tasty options.  If you're not into seafood, the menu is limited, but still tasty.  I recommend this place.
Shark Tacos!!!! It's been so long since I had good shark!  The fresh mango chunks add a nice touch.  I'm definitely coming back to try more of the menu!

Had lunch here and sat outside. The misters cooled us slightly and felt good. Had fish ceviche as an app; a nice dish to share. The homemade sangria was very refreshing. My wife had the scallop tacos. Be aware they use bay scallops not sea scallops. I had tge seafood di mare tamale which was incredible. Each dish is served with a small side of rice, beans and salsa with chips. We will definitely return!

The weather was perfect over the weekend, we decided to head over to downtown Gilbert for lunch.

This was my first time to So Cal Taco and it's not bad. Limited indoor seating the back outdoor patio seating was very appealing. They have heaters for the cooler weather and a couple TV's.

Casual and genuine. The menu is ample providing many choices. We are here for the tacos.

Service was friendly and pretty quick however, the kitchen seemed to be on the slow side.

We ordered the;
Cod, nothing special just good.
Blackened Grouper was overdone.
Lobster the batter was very salty and took everything away from it being Lobster.
Mai the better of the four ImO...
I wish the beans and rice was a larger serving. 

Price is a little on the higher side and you'd think the tacos would be on point!
Definitely will revisit to see if we can push the rating up.

A place I sought out for clam strips. It was excellent and reasonably priced. Has both inside seating and outside patio with heaters. Being from Seattle where clam strips are commonly deep fried, it was of the same quality and price.
Always great food and service.  Highly recommend So Cal for a taco and brew. Very friendly staff and comfortable environment I side or out. Love the outside patio feels like a awesome backyard.
Have been here multiple times and have always had good service and great food. The atmosphere is nice and relaxed and the margaritas are good!

Great little place.  We ordered the fish ceviche, clam strips, cod tacos, and carnitas tacos.  A couple of beers and a sangria as well.  Park in the back and sit outside on the patio.  The service was consistent and above average.  We go to The Farmhouse, across the street, for breakfast all the time.  This place is family owned and has fresh seafood.  Where the hell else are you going to find that anywhere near Gilbert.  All of the food was very good.  We wanted to try a variety since it was our first visit.  The ceviche was tasty but if I'm being super picky it could use a little more seasoning.  I eat ceviche frequently in CA.  Bottomline, good service, good food, seafood from a local joint, and family owned. What more do we all need.

Came here on a Saturday for lunch. We sat right away on the patio (we brought our 2 dogs). Service was great, tacos/beans/rice/salsa were all delicious.

Only slight disappointment was the ice cream cookie sandwich they offer for desert. They don't make them there but they look a lot better on the menu than they tasted.

Would recommend for the tacos !
This place is great. We ate here and we felt like we were on vacation. The calamari fries are incredible.

Recent transplants to AZ and love old downtown Gilbert! We decided to try this place because it offered both seafood/Mexican & craft brews. I ordered the clam strips for an appetizer but they ended up arriving with our entrees. I'd have preferred them as a pre-entree food. They were tasty, though! My hubby ordered the swordfish tacos and I ordered the shrimp tacos. They were delicious! However, you get 2 tacos and the side is, eye-balling, 1/3 cup of rice and 1/3 cup beans in individual paper cups. While tasty, we both felt it was a bit over-priced for what you get in a surf-shack style environment. Because of that; I'm inclined to keep looking for the ultimate experience.

Who knew this little place was going to be this good? The food, quite inexpensive, is VERY good. I had some crab cakes that were as good as any I've had, even when in Baltimore or Boston. The fish tacos were to die for. We left feeling quite full, and the bill was less than $25 for all of us.

This place is cool.  Very laid back and relaxed. The lobster taco was quite good.  The patio is great for a spring or fall day.  The service was a bit "laid back" as well but very friendly and overall totally worth it if you are down here around lunch time.

We had been waiting for this place to open for a long time.  Were stoked to see it was open.  Went in on a Thursday night about 7pm and waited about 15 minutes.  It is super small inside, the outside is bigger but hey it's like 110 degrees outside!  They sat us outside but the misters were great.  I didn't mind it at all.  Everyone there seemed like they were enjoying themselves.  We got drinks from our waiter who was really nice.

That was the best thing about it.  We ordered 2 appetizers and 2 entrees.  Our drinks were empty right away and stayed empty.  Then the misters went off...we still had no food after about 40 minutes.  The waiter was nice but he was just too busy to stay on top of all of the customers.  The food all came out at once, appetizers and entrees.  I asked for the misters to be turned back on as it was really hot...some of the other customers were also complaining.  They never came back on.  My fish and chips tasted frozen and everything was just about cold.  My husband said his Mahi tacos were very good.  We asked for more drinks and some sauces that never came.  We spent about 90 minutes there waiting and sweating.  The only positive was the Mahi tacos, so it definitely wasn't worth it.  BIG let down.

I've been wanting to try this place out for awhile now -- being a member of Funktional Fitness, I pass this place daily running my Funk lap! LOL - and finally stopped in for lunch after my workout. I was not disappointed! The Mahi fish tacos were amazing!  Next I'll be trying the "Funk Plate" (not featured on the menu) -- fresh catch of the day and veggies. Excellent food at a great price! *****

I hesitate to even review this place because I don't want the word to get out too much.  This is a hidden gem right on the main drag in downtown Gilbert.  The back patio is amazing, service is fantastic, and so is the happy hour deal.

The wife and I came in around 5 on a Saturday and sat outside with no trouble.  We drank beer and margaritas and tried every taco we could get our hands on.   Everything was superb, but the most memorable was the cod taco.  So well done.

This spot is getting into the regular rotation for sure, and we may even be back tonight.  Definitely worth a try!
The Beer batter mahi tacos are the bomb, and don't get me started on the tortilla soup yuuum! It's a laid back environment that doesn't disappoint.

Maybe I missed something but this place just didn't wow me. It was around lunch time when we went and the place was almost empty. The set up was just awkward since it is such a small narrow space. We walked in from the parking lot and couldn't quite figure out where to go because there was no one around. The outside patio looked great but it was far too hot, maybe it'll be nicer in the cooler months(or month). The place has character, I'll give it that, but comes across as what an interior designer would consider coastal not quite a laid back beach taco place. We ordered a cheese tortilla with shrimp as an appetizer, it was delicious. The fish tacos were just okay. The mahi mahi taco was good but they were pretty bland with the tiniest amount of mango salsa. For a fish taco company I was expecting more, especially for the price.

I have gone multiple times, and each time I have had great service and food.  When family comes to town, we'll take them here and eat out on the patio.  We always start with oysters and then have nummy fish tacos.  Very chill atmosphere!

I had such high hopes for this place and it was just okay. Lobster tacos are my favorite thing to eat, like last supper on death row meal. The lobster tacos here were just okay. For $14 I was surprised how small they were. A little bigger then a street taco but not as big as a regular sized taco. I felt the lobster was over breaded so it got lost. The Baja sauce was nothing special. I have had much more flavorful Baja sauce on fish and lobster tacos elsewhere. The rice and beans with the meal were very good however. My son got the kids chicken and fries which was so disappointing. They were processed chicken nuggets. My daughter enjoyed the fried shrimp she got but we were surprised it didn't include tartar sauce of some kind. The outdoor atmosphere was really cool; very relaxing. Very clean bathrooms. We will come back but order something different.

Come here for taco Tuesday, even though they don't have any special pricing for you on Tacos on Tuesday.

I usually get the tacos Locos.
Definitely want to get some sort of seafood dish while you're here with the tacos.

Taco Loco has the sauteed Mahi, shrimp, and scallops. You only get two tacos. Which is definitely not enough if you're hungry. But it's pretty good, to where you might question yourself if you want to get another plate of two. But then you look at the prices and can't really justify it. 

The mahi, shrimp, and scallops are cooked pretty good. There is some flavor but you definitely need to use the salsa on the side to get that moisture. They do cut the pieces really tiny, so sometimes you do want to get a bigger chunk, but it's not there.

Comes with a side of rice and beans.

Price $9.5.

Service is really friendly and pretty quick.
They do have outdoor seating in the back. They have heaters for the cold weather. They will move it for you.
Some TVs playing sports game.

Also a cool fire pit if you want to chit chat around there.

E-Z Parking Lot access in the back.


Bottom line, expensive cost for tacos. Good tacos, but if you're hungry you won't be full. You will question your judgement if you want another plate. But you will think to yourself, for that price, you could get three more tacos elsewhere, but it probably won't be Seafood.

Also they serve alcohol here.
I knew I was hooked when I saw "Cali" in the title. Just ask for the suggested top fav tacos and you will enjoy all!

Service was fine, although I felt a bit rushed out the door. The food was disappointing. The crab cakes were burned on the outside, although tasted fine on the inside. Glad I tried it, but next time I want crab cakes I'll go across the street to Postino.

We were excited to try this place, but were quickly disappointed. The space inside is a TINY corridor, so your server constantly paces up and down alongside your table. The water is Gilbert tap water- blech! Any filter or RO would greatly improve the odor and taste of the water. 

I was still holding hope the fish tacos would save the day. Nope. Rubio's has better fish tacos and they're cheap on Tuesdays. I spent $8 on the Ahi Tacos, and could only stomach two bites. They cooked the heck out of the chunk of Ahi; either this was an accident or they don't use high-quality Ahi which can be served rare. It tasted like canned tuna, and there was hardly any sauce on the tortilla to add flavor. There was NO seasoning on the fish itself. To be fair, my date's Tilapia tacos were well-seasoned thin filets (they advertise a lemon pepper seasoning) and were enjoyable. 

They serve the tacos with a side of rice-a-roni, watery pinto beans and some super hot watery salsa. I love spicy food, and I could not consume this salsa. If you like pinto beans (undrained) from a can, you're in luck. 

We love fish tacos from The Reel Inn in CA, and we get that Gilbert is a long way from any beach. Still, if you're going to name you're restaurant "So Cal Fish Taco Company," please deliver something remotely similar to what you advertise. I hope this restaurant can improve and offer some quality fish tacos to downtown Gilbert.

Some friends and I came here for date night /taco Tuesday. Absolutely the worst service! I'm leaving 2 stars because my food was good, but I can't say the same for my friends that joined us. It took almost an hour for our food to come out, drinks on the table we're empty, no refills, no service from the server to make sure we were okay waiting and no explanation as to what was taking so long. This story may be different/understandable for a packed house; however, 5 tables! We won't be returning. Take your business to Joyride. We ended up there after we left (5:30-8 for dinner at socal) walked into joyride got our food and margaritas left by 9 o'clock! don't waste your time with this place.

My husband was told great things about this Taco place so we decided to give it a try. It was very disappointing coming from someone that grew up in SoCal and has had some very Authentic Tacos. The sides were tasteless, and the portions were very small. It was expensive for the portions and my fish tacos were very salty. Unfortunately, I will not come to this place again. There are much better taco joints with better prices in the valley. Backyard Taco in Mesa and Santa Madre in Tempe are my go to for Taco Tuesday!
Food was great.  Loved the outdoor seating.  Kids were happy.  Will definitely return.

Ok, This is a follow up visit. We were here about a week ago, came back today for lunch, you know to see if first visit was a fluke........and it was no fluke. I had the same delicious Cod tacos, my wife had the fish and chips and we also had the crab cakes. I don't really care for anything but fish, so I tried the crab cakes, and boy, these were GREAT! My wife loved them too. She loved her fish, and I loved her fish as well, we share, and our server, she was so nice to us, we sat outside in the heat and it was very nice!. We are now going to be regular customers. I Give this place a big "Woo Hoo"

I love this place! Server Steele was cool! Mahi tacos were delicious.  Beer prices fantastic, $3.50 for an Ultra.  Arrived at 3:00, Saturday afternoon, got a table immediately.  Cup of Clam Chowder was good. Oysters were very small, but they did give us 7 on a 1/2 dozen order. 
My favorite fish tacos are at South Beach Bar and Grill, Ocean Beach San Diego... SoCal Fish Taco Co had Tacos just as tasty.
Wife and I will be Back.
Another great downtown Gilbert eatery.  Great clam chowder, decent beer selections and friendly staff.

One of my favorite places to eat, esp when weather is nice and we can eat on their patio. My favorite menu items are coconut shrimp and fish and chips (cooked a little longer). Service is always good.

My husband and I ate here for the first time last night and all I can say is YUM! We shared the calmari fries and they were delicious, as was the aeoli that came with them (which says a lot because I don't usually like aeoli). The shark tacos were good. I loved the white sauce and mango salsa. My husband got the shrimp tacos and thoroughly enjoyed them as well. We definitely plan on coming back. I would highly recommend coming here.
We love this place! Servers are friendly, atmosphere is perfection, and food is delicious! I get fish tacos pretty much everywhere I can, and SoCal is definitely one of my favorites, hands down!

Rude to customers.  Food is OK, but nothing to holler about.  I used to go to this guy's dad's restaurant, until they showed how rude they could be.  Thought this man was different, but his attitude towards customers seems to be the same.  If politeness, along with good food is what you are looking for, I don't recommend this joint.

My friend lives out in Gilbert and we decided to cruise around this area to find something to eat. As soon as I saw the fish tacos sign, I knew that's what I had to have. Their menu is filled with a refreshingly large number of seafood options and it was honestly difficult to not order several things for myself. I chose the shrimp tacos with rice and beans, and I was pleasantly surprised. The shrimp themselves had a ton of flavor. The rice and beans were so/so, but I could tell how fresh the shrimp were and I wish I had a chance to try something like ceviche.

First timers here today. I called ahead and asked if there was a happy hour, there was! I think he said 12-6 or something. Sweet.

Anywho, we looked over both menus. Both looked great! They offer tacos, sandwiches, wraps, salads, ceviche etc. 

They also have a decent craft beer selection and margaritas n wine/sangri. 

We opted to try the happy hour menu and it was perfect! It's a $5 happy hour menu. We got a basket of 3 tacos, your choice of meat. We got all fish. They're small but delicious! Great flavor on the fish! Typical items in it. 

We also got the ceviche tostadas. Two of em were decent size and packed with ceviche. It was all very fresh tasting. Something was a hair off about the lime juice though. Idk if it was bottled/concentrate or what but I just couldn't put my finger on what it was. All in all delicious and invigorating! 

Last dish we tried was the buffalo shrimp! Big pile and they were awesome! Not too spicy. Served with ranch. 
 
Topped it off with bucket of small Dos Equis for another $5 and we were set. 

$21 before tip for 3 appetizers and 3 small beers. 

Loved it.
The fish is good. The overall plate could be improved greatly. The tortillas need seasoning. The beans are bland. The rice is excellent. Serving in plastic baskets with plastic forks is lame.

I love this place! I found out about So-Cal Fish Taco Company from a friend of mine after discussing my experience at another one in the area. Wholey moley! I am so glad they had made the recommendation because it literally changed my life. 

Most importantly this is a local restaurant joint and it is so good every single time! 

My first visit was a little odd because I wasn't exactly sure whether we sat ourselves or had to be seated. I'm still not sure I understand how it works but I take a seat on the patio outside and it isn't long before a staff member will walk by and ask if I've been helped. 

The calamari fries? Bomb! I've had a few of their tacos and regardless of what I chose all I can say is BOMB BOMB BOMB! I heard a rumor that there is some tie to a fish market. I heard a rumor that the fish is fresh. I am not sure if these rumors are true but I can tell you that the fish tastes fresh and I believe that it came from the market or a market. 

The menu options are perfect in my opinion because there aren't too many to choose from that you can't decided but just enough to give options. They also have some pretty awesome beer selections. 

Unfortunately, I'm supposed to limit my amount of seafood due to a thyroid condition and so I can't eat here as often as I would like to. However, I would recommend this place to anyone to checkout and I bet upon the first visit, you'll be back for more.

Pretty legit place. Between my wife and I, we got the mahi mahi beer battered fish tacos, crab cakes, shark tacos, and clam chowder. If you have a large party, get it to go. Not much room inside, but they have a great accommodating staff that will take care of you. The shark tacos were ok. It could have honestly been bass and I wouldn't have know they difference. The crab cakes were awesome. Flaky, tender, and perfectly seasoned. I'm from California off the coast and this clam chowder was some of the best I have ever had. The mahi mahi taco was legit too. We will definitely be back again!

If you're looking for a casual place to hang out with a relaxing patio, this spot is it. Great prices and the fish tacos are yummy. So is the fish n chips and the ice cream sandwich for dessert. My daughter gives this place two thumbs up and she is not easy to please!

Calamari was great, lobster taco was amazing and fish and chips were very good. Homemade cocktail sauce, tarter sauce and salsa all worth the trip alone.

Awesome local joint with awesome food and a fun atmosphere.
Every time I've been here its been good!, I wasn't a fan of fish tacos really, but now I am! I love the salmon wrap they have a good potrion of fish in them.

There are two taco places on Gilbert Rd in close proximity and in my opinion this is the better of the two.  It is a kick back place where you get a bottle of beer and some great fish tacos. 

Nothing fancy about it but it is some of the best fish tacos I've had locally. The mahi mahi tacos are my favorite and you have to try the clam chowder as well.  My sister drives all the way from Phoenix to get their food.

I noticed that they have happy hour and I haven't had a chance to try that yet but it is definitely on the list.

We couldnt wait to try this place, and weren't disappointed! Great location, wonderful decor, friendly staff and very tasty food.
Our first time, my husband had the corona battered fish and chips, and i had the mahi tacos with mango salsa. Both delicious. I'm a Brit and he's Irish, so it's hard for us to eat fish and chips out and not be disappointed, but theirs is very good.
We have been here 5 or 6 times now and will keep coming back. Owner is very friendly and accomodating. They even managed to seat us and 7 family members who were visiting from Ireland and had never tried any Mexican food (they all enjoyed it). I think I've had most every taco on the menu now and it's hard to pick a favourite, but the crispy cod tacos are amazing!
Probably the worst tacos on the planet. Shrimp tacos had no flavor.  Paid tab of $31 and I sent my food back. That was just for one lunch meal. Ridiculous!

For years I have been driving North to Mesa for my fried oysters fix. To my relief I discovered that the SoCal Fish Taco Co has fried oysters as well as an oyster Po Boy sandwich! I have been accustomed to the frozen two inchers that I get from the fish & chip joints. SoCal's are freshly breaded and 3"-4" long. And the flavor was incredibly delicious. The service was quick and thorough. Under a ten minute wait. Plastic silverware,napkins,lemons & tartar sauce included. I will definitely be back soon to try the Blackened Grouper Tacos and other menu items.

So... The fish is great. Crispy, fresh tasting and really yummy. The fries are good too. Our waitress was really attentive and overall I had a good experience. Unfortunately, all the other food is just not great. The tortillas were really basic and not even warmed up. The rice tasted old and I couldn't even eat it. They put cotija cheese on the tacos but they didn't put any on the beans (which would have been appreciated). I would have preferred black beans, but that's just a personal choice. The clam chowder wasn't bad but it wasn't something to rave about either. It's priced a bit high for what they offer and how they present it (think picnic style with plastic utensils and Styrofoam). Overall, not a bad experience. The outdoor space is really nice and, for the ambiance it's good. Everything else is just average, hence the rating.

FIVE STARS! I just moved to Gilbert from Boston. Was searching for a place that offered "New England Clam Chowder and Fish N Chips. I must say, I'm AMAZED! The cod is flakey, the batter is crisp and the chowder is PERFECT!! Look no more! I've found my new favorite seafood

The tacos are consistently good and the staff is always friendly and prompt. The chips and salsa are just ok and I wish they'd just serve on plates instead of creating so much garbage with each order. I would eat there more often if it weren't for all the paper, plastic and styrofoam.

What a cool find in old town Gilbert,AZ
Good priced taco combos with a great laid back patio in the back. This isn't a sports bar, but there are TVs.

Only suggestion is, add more Mexican beer options. 
Remember,  tacos is Mexican, you must have Negra Modelo, Modelo Especial and Tecate.

But overall. .. nice spot
What a gem! First time here and will definitely be back! Fresh and tasty tacos and The service was great!
I love SoCal! Fresh, affordable and one of my favorite places to go for lunch. Yummy chips and salsa and delicious fish tacos.
If you're going to charge 4 for chips and salsa, you might want to make sure  the chips are warm and not stale!!! I've ate here a few times now and I'm not that impressed

I was expecting this place to be an order at the counter sort of place, but it ended up being a sit down restaurant.  We ordered the crab cakes, which didn't have that much flavor, although we did really like the tarter sauce that came with them.  My hubby and I loved the pinto beans that came with our beer battered fish and grilled shrimp tacos.  They are a little bit spicy and they have some crunch with the onion and green pepper.  Hubby also loved the rice.  It was moist and flavorful.  We weren't as impressed with the tacos.  I thought the beer batter would add flavor to the fish tacos, but the only thing with flavor was the cream sauce.  The shrimp in the shrimp tacos didn't have much seasoning at all.  If it wasn't for the sauces, the tacos would have totally fallen flat.  The service was great and our server was very friendly and attentive, but I doubt we'll be back because the food fell short.

I love going to So-Cal fish taco. The place is a bit small and there isn't a ton of seating available, but the food is really good and reasonably priced. I'm not a big fish eater but I do enjoy the fish tacos from here. I usually get steak though. The food is always fresh and delicious. It's a nice atmosphere, always kept clean / neat and its in a cool part of town. The staff is always helpful as well. I will continue to go to so-cal anytime my wife and I want some good tacos. Actually, now that I am writing this review, I am getting hungry just thinking about it. I might just stop in for some fish tacos today! Keep doing what you do so-cal. I will be back for sure. The only reason it's not a 5 star is because the dining area is so small. Otherwise, everything is fantastic.
Love the patio here. Fun to sit outside & have a margarita & fish tacos. We've been a number of times & food & service has been consistently good. Easy to find parking behind as well.

We kept saying we wanted to try this place, but today, we finally did, and are we ever glad!  We were on the way home from an appointment, and stopped in for lunch.  We parked behind in the large lot, then as we walk through the back patio, even though it was 100 degrees plus, we decided to sit there since there were fans and misters.  We had the Peach/green tea, and calamari, then we had the SoCal and mahi tacos.  Had the mahi without breading.  Both came with rice and beans.  The rice and beans were fresh, but just so-so.  The tacos (2/serving) were the best we have had in a long time.  Very good service, also.  We will be going back!!
This place was fantastic. Great food and service. Staff was very friendly and prompt. They had a good selection of beers and a beautiful patio area to sit with friends and hang out. Highly recommend!

The ambiance is super simp√°tico, we loved it.  The inside was quite cozy, four 4 tops and two 2 tops.  Plenty of seating outside ands while it was cold, they had a lot of patio heaters going.  Great use of space.

Hubby and I ordered 4 different plates to try and taste a bit of everything.  The calamari fries are way yummy, crispy and the squid is cooked perfectly.  The dipping sauces were very tasty.  The cod fish tacos were spot on, delicious balance of fish and condiments.
The low points were the mahi fish tacos and the clam chowder.  
The mahi was too delicate for the mango salsa. I could only taste the mango salsa in the fish, nothing more.  
The clam chowder must have been bottom of the pot as it was super salty and a bit gummy.  I am sure under other circumstances it would have been great.
Terrific Fish and chips in a casual atmosphere.  Will definitely be back!  We ate outside but also inside available

My fiance and I decided to try So-Cal Fish Taco Company. Got there and it was a full house. My fiance had the shrimp burrito and I ordered fish n' chips. Waited 20 minutes for our order to arrive. Saw the basket and we both immediately said, "really??". Waited 20 minutes and portions in the basket was sad. Hook up the fries in the basket!! Good food but nothing extrodinary that makes me want to return to this restraunt. Along with that, I thought to myself, "well it is a fish taco joint, I should at least try one of their fish tacos." From reading other reviews and talking to others, So-Cal Fish Taco Company is just another fancy place where over priced average fish taco are being served.
The environmental is fun and the scenery is cool, but it's pretty high priced for not ALOT of food. It was good food but way over priced for the size and portion.
Greatest mahi taco I've tasted. Never eating at Rubio's again. Do yourself a favor and check this place out. Wife got the shrimp and loved it.

I was so disappointed in this place. The staff was great but the food was awful. Had the beer battered mahi tacos and it was one strip of fried fish, tasted like it came from a microwave fish tray. The corn tortilla was very dry, sprinkled with a little bit of cabbage. The beans were cold and tasted like the canned ranch beans. The rice was also cold, still raw and flavorless. And the price we paid for them? Won't be going back here ever.

I would give them 4 stars even though the food took forever and we got the wrong order because the food was good. The mahi tacos, scallops and chips, and lobster tacos were delicious and affordable. Plus our waiter was nice even tho he made the order mistake. I would still come here again despite this experience.

Seriously good fish tacos!  Walked in at 7 on a Saturday night and was immediately seated.  2 adults, 1 kid, and 1 high chair.  SWEET!  Decor is awesome.  The patio has nice lighting so you're not sitting in the dark or barely able to see what you're eating.  After we were seated it did take about 7 mins for our server to notice us and get our drinks and since we had the extra time we also knew what we wanted to eat.  After that initial wait the service was great though.

On to the food!  Ordered Clam strips for an app. Super yummy.  A tad bit chewy, but the hubs and I didn't mind.  Got the kids' popcorn chicken and fish and chips at that time.  Both got the seal of approval from 2 picky eaters.  One minor thing was that the fries were pretty under done almost inedible.  I don't give them fries that much so we just ate the ones that were done and they couldn't even finish those.  Good sized kids portions even without the fries.  
Grown up meals:  We wanted to try a few items.  Got orders of shrimp tacos, ahi tuna tacos and blackened grouper tacos.  All of them were cooked to perfection!  Nothing was even close to being overcooked, seriously perfect.  While all the tacos were great the blackened grouper was the stand out by far.  The beans were also amazing.  Something as simple as pinto beans and SoCal made them memorable.  The rice was just meh, unfortunately got some uncooked grains in with the cooked, mmmm crunchy goodness, not so much.  The mango salsa was flavorful with a nice kick to it.  I don't know what the 1 star guy was talking about with everything being canned and bland.  The cocktail sauce was a bit ketchupy but that's about it.  Also got a Long Island Iced Tea, good but for $6 it was small at around 10 oz.  

Overall:  nice ambiance, small service and kitchen hiccups with it being new, the tacos are what matter and they are STELLAR!  Will definitely recommend to friends and family and be back frequently.

Normally I love this place! Today they were very unprepared for the lunch crowd!!  Never have I waited so long for service! Someone simply stopping by our dirty table, introducing themselves and letting us know it would be a few minutes was obviously too much to ask for. We walked out and walked across the street to Joyride Taco House where we were greeted with a smile, and impeccable service even though they have a packed house as well.
Nice outdoor patio area and we have always had good service.  Nice variety of Fish Tacos and their Shrimp Ceviche was very good didn't like their Margaritas so we now stick to beer.
It is what it is! Awesome! Food and service spot on. Too bad they are not closer to home....Maybe open up in Prescott?

I have had the shrimp bowl and the tamale del mar. Both are incredible but the tamale is hands down my new GO TO! When we call for pick-up, both guys who have answered have both super friendly and knowledgeable with all the questions we had. Lunch is the best time to go because you can actually find a space inside. Outdoor area is nice but it's a bit hot during the summertime (they do have misters though). Parking in the back is easy to find when it's not Thurs-Saturday.

The review is pretty high here, but why the tacos we ordered didn't even hold together? We could not enjoy our food because it all fell apart after the first bite. Crab cakes were pretty good. Environment is good!

Finally made my way into socal fish company and boy was I surprised.
The outside patio was inviting and the service was on point.
I had to try the oyster po boy which was very very tastey. The true oyster taste was excellent and at a reasonable 8.00
My fiance had a trio of tacos which were also good.
My only gripe would be the oh so standard frozen fries.
They are what they are......
It's time for a good frie folks.
Good experience.....i'll be back

I always prefer the Mom and Pop shops to anything from a chain.  This place is a perfect example of the reason why:
1) Value: The prices here are more than fair.  We got out with our family of four for less than 35 bucks.
2) Quality:  The fish was all beyond fresh. The garnishes and tortillas were the same.  Very fresh and very tasty.
3) Service:  Casual and genuine.  The drinks never had a chance to get empty and the kids never had a chance to get bored waiting.  
4) Taste:  I personally had the mahi tacos.  Wow!  They were jammed with fish and the mango salsa paired with them was fantastic.  
This place is a must try.  Worth a drive if you aren't in the neighborhood.  My kind of food!

My boyfriend and his family were so excited to try this place out, but we all left completely unhappy.

For starters, once we sat down at a table it took what seemed like forever until we were waited on. Then when we finally place our food orders, it took way too long to come out to our table. Portion were extremely small, as if it came from the kids menu! When we asked for hot sauce, they brought out sriracha (claiming that was all they had), which is fine but considering it's a fish taco company they should have a variety of sauces/salsa for their foods! Then when someone else wanted more hot sauce, our waiter brought out Chulula! Which was really annoying because we were just told the only hot sauce they had was Sriracha. 

When we got our bill in the end we were even more disappointed to see that the each beer was overpriced and cost MORE than one order of our food! That's just ridiculous. Beer wasn't even good for being "specialty" from California.

Definitely wont be returning here again.

Tacos are great. Service is good. Price is a little on the higher side.  Cod and Mahi Mahi are the best tacos I had so far. Tried the lobster tacos and they were not as good as the other ones. 

Don't ask for water probably the worst tasting water in the state. Filtering or something not sure why. 

Baja sauce is delicious.
Margaritas, good for happy hour. The prices on tacos for taco Tuesday are worth it! Service wasn't so friendly.

Tiny place, but nice. Food was great (minus the salad). Service was a little slow. I ended up getting up and refilling my own drink. The waitress had a piercing in her arm that looked infected- a little gross. Should have been covered up, especially around food.  but she was nice. We had mahi tacos and chicken tacos and a small Caesar salad. The salad was HORRIBLE!  It tasted like acidy Italian dressing- lettuce, crumbled cheese, and tortilla strips and WAY too much dressing.  We WILL definitely go back for the TACOS. Pass on the salad. We've eaten at lulu tacos down the way- WAY over priced and greasy and joyride across the street- WAY WAY overpriced and weird foo foo tree hugger type food. This place was definitely the best by far!!!

Recommended by a friend, we stopped here for an early dinner with our dog. The servers were very accommodating about having our dog with us which was important to us.

We were seated at the outside dining area. The whole place is very casual, but the food is exceptional! The food is served on paper plates!

We had the Tamale Del Mar which was excellent. The Steak Salad was fresh and the salsa ranch dressing was delicious. We had the crab cakes for an appetizer and they were quite good as well.

Lots of parking in the back. This is destined to be a regular stop for us.

My husband was craving fish & chips and being from SoCal, we decided to stop here for dinner with the kids.  It turned out to be a great idea.  We tried the calamari fries, chicken tortilla soup, clam chowder, fish & chips, shrimp & chips, and several different types of fish tacos.  Everything was delicious! We definitely felt like we were back in SoCal enjoying a meal by the beach.  The staff was helpful and friendly too.  It was extremely cold outside and the wait inside would be awhile, so they suggested we sit outside on the patio and they would turn on the heat lamps for us.  We weren't quite sure that sounded like a good idea but decided to give it a try.  It turned out great.  Not only did they move heat lamps to both sides of our table to make sure we were warm, but we had the whole patio to ourselves...and what a nice patio it was! We are excited to have found a great little spot not too far from home for the occasions when we are craving seafood.
The fish is good here and I like the outdoor patio area,  the atmosphere really  feels like you are in California!
We really enjoyed our food and the service was great- our waitress was super friendly. We would recommend the fish/seafood selections over the carne. The fish and chips were awesometotally recommend!

Good inexpensive seafood in Gilbert, AZ??? What????  It's true.  This place is legit.  Try the fish tacos with shark,  Calimari Fries(yeah the thick cut calimari battered and fried) ,  Clam chowder,  Fish and chips.  Kind of weird you get beans and rice with some dishes.  Slaw with others. 

Seafood enchilada was not bad.  I don't drink but, buddy said there was good selection of beers.  He seemed to enjoy the two he tried. 

Good seafood for a reasonable price.   Didn't try any of the non-seafood stuff.

Went back for seconds today and had the mahi tacos. The fish was cooked well, the sauce was great, the salsa much improved, and the rice and beans are still very good. And they had take-out menus for the folks at work!

Tuesday Taco Day !  Woo Hoo ! ! ! 
The Cod Tacos were very very tasty.

Fresh and delicious So Cal food! Had come with the family - and the mahi mahi tacos were delicious!! And the place has a cool vibe...made me feel for the hour I was there that I'm chilling in a beach town rather than in the hot desert :) 
And service was super fast! Excellent when one is hungry :)

The food was good the price for the caliber of food was definitely tied to the location .  Being that it's surrounded by old town Gilbert and tons of vintage spots it makes for a great pit stop .  But if you have a serious appetite don't expect to get full .

So-Cal Fish Taco's are really good! My girlfriend ordered the shrimp taco platter, she got this based on our servers recommendation and she nailed it. My g/f thought they were some of the best she'd had. I ordered Cod tacos, the panko breading was very good, they were piping hot, and from the time we ordered the wait time was only about 5 minutes. My favorite part was the salsa, they really made the taco in my opinion. Very good and would recommend.

High expectations because of the laid back and chill atmosphere. Little seating inside, cool patio seating. Happy to see they serve cocktails and beer. I ordered crab cakes recommended by our server, they arrived in a bed of oil and luke warm in the center. They tasted like tuna from the Gordon smith guy at the local grocery store. I also ordered a Long Island ice tea, immediately I could tell by the color of the drink it was a mix or they had a first day bar keep.  I tasted it and it actually tasted like ice tea. The server asked if I wanted a substitute and I got a tasty bottled brew. Good looking out, props.  The food was mediocre at best. Hard rice and I swear canned ranch style beans. My date ordered carnitas, I ordered mahi tacos. We should of went to rubios.  

Pros...80's music, cool patio seating, prices, nice server.  

Cons...food, drinks, ugh!

Loved it! Had clam chowder, chicken tortilla soup, coconut shrimp, lobster tacos, ahi tacos, and sangria all of it was delicious! The inside was small but cute. The patio is bigger and inviting! Our server was fantastic! We will be back!

First time visiting this new taco shop in downtown Gilbert. The interior is small (maybe 8 tables) but there's a large patio in the back with plenty of misters and shade. I went around lunch time and was happy to see the place pretty much packed. In fact, I had to wait about 5 minutes to get an indoor table. We met the owner, who seemed like a cool guy- friendly and thankful for our business. His father owns a seafood market in Mesa so the food served his is super fresh and never frozen. The decor is surfer/beach with surfboards hanging on the walls and beach blue shades of paint splashed everywhere. 

The menu is simple with great options. Of course the specialty is tacos and, more specifically, fish tacos. My buddy ordered the fried cod tacos and I went with the chicken (they offer carnitas and steak as well). For $6 I got 3 good sized tacos loaded with a good portion of grilled chicken, cabbage, diced radish, onion, cilantro, and an avocado/garlic sauce. They were delicious and filling. You also got two small sides of rice and whole pinto beans (+ a small side of their house salsa for additional flavor). It's a great deal for the $6 and seems to be much cheaper than the rival taco house located further down the street (Joyride). I also ordered their chips & salsa, which were tasty and a good way to get started. You have to order this ($2) as they are not complimentary with the meal. My friend's fish tacos (2 of them) were large and full of fish. He liked them very much (he's already visited 7 or 8 times).

Overall, I would definitely come back for another visit. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They don't pester you but know right when to swing by for refills, check-ups, etc. 

Price, friendliness, high quality food, good drink options, and a great menu should take you to SoCal Fish Taco Company.

Visited So Cal Fish Company tonight. My husband and I asked our excellent waiter for a recommendation. We ordered the beer battered mahi and shrimp fish tacos as he suggested and we were blown away. So delicious. Hot and flaky fish was perfectly battered. The combination of sauces and accompaniments were perfectly paired here. We also were equally impressed by our appetizer- a platter of coconut shrimp. The batter was crispy and flavorful, while the shrimp was fresh and hot. Patio dining added to our experience. WE WILL DEFINITELY RETURN- YUM!!!

I have been waiting for this place to open... So, the husband and I finally checked it out tonight. I will say that it wasn't horrible but wasn't GREAT! At first it started out wonderful, as everyone was pleasant and greeted us when we came in. Ordered our food, once again, no problems. 

We ordered some oysters as an app and they were delicious and tasted fresh. This is when the problems started...so our waiter brings our daughters food out and is like "is there anything else?" And we kind of look at him like "yeah, our food.." After a minute of the weird looks he is all "your tacos....WILL BE RIGHT UP!" And he made this face like "oh shit, I forgot." So, we waited and waited and waited.... about  an additional 20 minutes while everyone who got here after us, got served their food before us. Word to the wise.. I am much cooler if you would have told us. We get it, you just opened, we would cut you some slack, if you gave us the chance. 

So, the sun is going down at this point and someone needs to tell them that when the sun starts to set YOU TURN OFF THE MISTERS. It gets cold and wet as opposed to nice like when the sun is up. I heard many people around us complaining about the misters, as well. Also, I don't know if there was some kind of mix up with the servers but we watched two different sets of people get totally forgot about at a table near us. The first couple just straight up left, while we had to sit and listen ( we saw more than one bus boy notice this situation... um hello DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT) to the second set of people complain about the poor service.

By now, we have just got our food and the tacos were good. I got the shrimp tacos and husband got mahi mahi tacos. Neither of us had any complaints about the food. My shrimps were large and cooked great. My daughter got the popcorn shrimp and that was actually really good, very pleasantly surprised. Next, we tried to pay and that took about about 10 minutes to get our check back after our waiter took our card...I don't get why that took so long!? Go run the card and come back.

So, all in all, the food was good. The service just needs some help. My husband said it best, they need an on-duty aware manager (which they did not appear to have) to make sure tables aren't forgot, turn off misters..etc. So..hopefully they see this and use it as constructive criticism because I really did like the ambiance and food..just with a few hitches. But, we will be back. I'm going to give it a few weeks and try again since the food was good.

My daughter and i came for lunch today. We parked in the back and walked through the open dining and inside dining on our way to the hostess station. We noticed five or six open tables on our way in. We were surprised to hear from the hostess that there was a 10-15 minute wait to be seated. 

(What? Can i just go sit down at one of the six open tables?) 

We waited and were seated within the promised window. We ordered calimari fries to start, with my daughter ordering fish and chips, and salmon tacos for myself.

The calimari fries came out hot, crispy, and were very tasty. We finished them off quickly. Both sauces were great.

Next delivered, were my daughters fish and chips, and some shrimp and chips that looked yummy, but were not what i ordered. The waiter promised a quick fix. I noticed the patrons at a neighboring table having bewildered looks, and no food on their table, despite being seated before us.

The salmon tacos arrived within five minutes. The fish was near perfectly cooked, the tortillas tender but not frail, overall very delicious. My daughters fish and chips were tasty, good crunch on the outside with tasty fish inside. Chips were reasonable, but not inspiring. The beans and rice that came with my meal were sufficient.

Waitstaff were nice enough, but maybe a little inexperienced, and slow at times. Their willingness to try makes it all good.

The dining experience overall was positive, but i don't know if i would drive any extra miles to dine here. If i happen to be close, ill probably drop in. (Ill bet that i would have given an extra star if there had not been a line with tables empty, and the wrong meal being delivered.)

My boyfriend and I just had dinner and this place is perfect! Great service and friendly owner. Happy to celebrate 5th anniversary of this cool delicious restaurant. Highly recommend. Great price too.

YumYumYUM! I've been here twice in two weeks, and it's so yummy. Joyride Fish Taco is across the street and is good too, but way more expensive than this place. 

Great prices, many options, and awesome tacos.

The mahi mahi, grouper, and shrimp tacos all rock and are very flavorful. Tacos come with a small side of beans and rice and a salsa (I'm guessing homemade) that's spicy and awesome.

First time visiting, will maybe return. We came on a Tuesday at 5pm, and there were plenty of tables available. Our server was relatively prompt with our drink orders, but food took awhile to arrive to our table. We ordered a taco plate, scallops and chips, and oyster po'boy. Tacos and scallops were good. Would not recommend the sandwich. Three fried oysters on a dry generic French roll, with (shredded) lettuce, tomato, and pickle on the side. I would normally expect some sort of remoulade sauce or at the very least some mayo on the bun, but it was bone dry. There was a side of cocktail sauce, not a normal condiment for po'boys, but ok. I stole some tarter sauce from the scallop plate and it was palatable. The other entrees were good, only complaint was that the sides were on the small side (served in condiment cups, more like garnish than a dinner side). We were doing good until the end of the meal, when we heard our server telling the table next to us that Tuesday is buy one get one half off taco plates. When we finally flagged him to get our check (at this point had been waiting around 10-15 min for it) we asked him about the special and said it would have been nice to know about it BEFORE we ordered...he didn't catch on or apologize for the error. After waiting another 10 minutes for him to pick up the check and have him walk by our table without notice we resorted to taking it inside to have the card run (and another wait). In total, we spent just over an hour there with most of time spent waiting. Also, they only have 2 high chairs in the place and they are both broken, so not exactly kid-friendly. Disappointing because we like to support local businesses, hopefully if we decide to try again the service will be better.

So-Cal is so-so:(  cute little place with good service, however the food presented was not of fresh ingredients or bold flavor. 

I tried the crab cakes which were okay, not my preference to deep fry, I'm more familiar & love the Boston fancy way honey, cooked to perfection in a skillet. On to the Clam Chowder in a bread bowl, I was super excited to try but was way disappointed, not fresh whatsoever this was nasty porridge in bread, ouch.

Finally the 3 Taco plate "Carne, Chicken & something else, forgot....oops. The Chicken Taco was old as if they re-served the chicken or had it had been there for awhile, I did mention this to our server that it was old, he did SMILE and say okay, silly boy was mesmerized by moi....or something.....lol

My final thoughts if it was a late night of  liquid poison, I would happily be back.....but since I don't....... Ciao
The shark tacos were great. The slaw they put on the tacos is better than most baja mexican joints. I didn't like the ceviche. It wasn't bad, it just didn't wow me.

Just returned from SoCal Fish Taco Co.  Very disappointing.  Decor and design was interesting, server good, but that's where it all ended.  Don't think much was made from scratch.  Everything tasted canned, salsa, weak cocktail sauce (more like regular ketchup) beans, tortillas......EVERYTHING.  

Really wanted to like this place.  No flavor/seasonings ... Boring.  Wish it was different.  Shrimp tacos and grouper tacos had no flavor at all.  Shrimp had watery/boiled texture.  Not worth it.  Missed opportunity for this company.
Food was terrific!  Service was fabulous.  Went for the first time and Ill definitely be coming back!

We came here today because i was craving for some tacos. I like the chill patio. But it was too cold for me, I have to borrow my bf's jacket. Our server was nice, he keeps on checking on us. We ordered shrimp ceviche for appetizer.. My mouth exploded! It was really good. For the main coarse my bf got shrimp po'boy, It was ok i had better po'boy before at Flavor's of Luisiana. It came with a cocktail sauce, I wish it came with a tartar sauce. I got the mahi tacos, the fish needs a lil seasoning and it was kinda overcooked. The mango salsa was really good it complements the fish, cabbage and the cojita cheese. I was disappointed with my rice because it was cold and hard.. But we will definitely come back for happy hour.

This place is pretty great the calamari fries are fantastic I could eat three orders by myself. The fish and chips is great I mean I haven't tried anything I haven't liked yes definitely a good place to eat in downtown Gilbert.

This is by far the best fish tacos I've ever had.  The flavor of the fish is so fresh! I had a salmon, shark and lastly a swordfish which were all amazing.  The inside is super clean and the staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. This is my new fish taco go to!!!

This place is great! I've been several times now and it's becoming a favorite. On top of good food, the outdoor seating area is nice during the cooler months. I've tried the mahi and salmon tacos, the mahi is now my go to. The last two visits we split an ice cream sandwich lightly rolled in sea salt, wow! Delicious!

The first time I came here I was less than pleased but I gave it another chance. The second time sealed the deal of me not ever returning. They say they have margaritas yet don't have a liquor license which likely means their $9 marg is filled with sweet n sour mix and rice wine. Food was average and over priced. Service was slightly below average. There are better fish taco joints for the money that serve real booze too.

Such a casual yet trendy place in Gilbert downtown. I tried their lime margarita and it had the perfect zing and kick. Their cod tacos were fantastic and so was the seafood tamale. For dessert we had the churros and boy they were so damn good. Freshly made and crisp. The staff was very warm and welcoming too. Definitely would go back here. Perfect hangout spot!
Great service, but the food was decent. We had the Mahi Mahi tacos, calamari fries and clam chowder. For a taco place the portions were small and expensive. Nice casual place.
Stopped in for lunch and was impressed with the range of selections. We had clam strips, clam chowder, Mahi tacos and shrimp and chips. All were excellent. Definitely coming back soon.

Just had dinner on the back patio. It was simply terrific. It's a great chill vibe and great service. We tried a lot of the items. We had clam chowder, crab cakes, tacos, fish and chips, and ceviche.  I didn't try one thing I didn't like. It was understated deliciousness and I will be coming back!
I give the homemade clam chowder a four out of five stars.....so good - Only thing missing is an ocean view!

Excellent tacos, slightly on the pricey side, I would go back. Similar to Rubios; I had the beer battered Mahi (2) and two small sides: rice and beans. Cool outdoor patio, great service, excellent location. Not bad for a quick bite on a date.

Love the chicken tacos. Healthy but tasty, fun atmosphere. I am not a fish person, but my bf and bestie tell me the calamari fries and tacos with lobster, shrimp, mahi mahi are all awesomeness. 
Service is always good. Love the patio.

Stopped by today for to go food,  3 tacos meal.. Customer service is outstanding... meal is delicious!!!
Great food for the price even on a busy  Friday afternoon.   Keep up the good work SoCal

We had seen an article in a local magazine about this place and decided to try it out last night for No Meat Friday.  The food looked great on the menu but was far from great when we got into it. The best word I can use to describe the food is Blah. The crab cakes were so-so. The chowder was a little bland. The cod tacos were bland and lacked anything special. The rice and beans were hard. The chips were over salted. Fish and chips were so-so. I would probably recommend this place for Happy Hour tacos since they are listed for $1, but aside from that try somewhere else.

Hands down best taco joint in Gilbert Heritage Square. Fish tacos.. On point. Shrimp tacos... On point. Lobster Tacos.. On point. Even their fish & chips & clam chowder is too die for. Honestly if I'm in the mood for seafood or tacos I alwaysssss go to SoCal. Their food lives up to the SoCal beach food crowd.

First time here today. Like seeing downtown Gilbert hopping. Hope it works for all of these places. Especially the locally owned ones. First off the guy who served me was very nice and attentive. Suggested I try both the cod and regular fish taco since I was wanting to try what they were known for. I liked the cod better actually. So glad he suggested both. Portions were average. It's a good quality fish taco. Quality above a rubios but not as good as Baja fish tacos. But close. Great atmosphere. Found out the owner was the one who helped me. Hope all his employees serve like that. Isn't that always the magic wand for places like this.   Go give this place a try and support local biz. Form your own opinion. But don't be a bitch. No one is perfect
Skip this place and go to Joyride Taco just down the street. Fish taco needed salt, lemon, and extra sauce that they charged us for!!!!
Had the lobster tacos and they were fantastic!  Can't wait to come back to try so more of the menu.

So the other fancy taco place across the street is packed or you don't have that much cash in your wallet, what do you do? Walk across the street to So-Cal and get your fish or shrimp tacos here because although they are different, they are just as good in their own way. These fish tacos are your more traditional Wahoo's type and are great and easy on the bank account. They have a small inside eating area but larger outdoor patio with misters.

I have also had the shrimp ceviche which was actually a large portion. I could have that for a light dinner by itself! I am not a drinker so I cannot comment on the alcoholic offerings.

Finding a good fish taco in Phoenix is difficult, so when I saw a place with fish taco in its name, I was pretty excited.

The fish ceviche tostadas were pretty good, although a little flimsy.  The mahi fish tacos were ok.  They needed more sauce and to change tortillas.

Decent service, although our server did mess up what was on whose check.

I'll be back because I want to try more of their fish tacos.  This place has better fish tacos than most in Phoenix, but if it was in SoCal, I'm not sure I'd come here again.

I had heard from a few friends how good the tacos were here and I have to say we were very disappointed.  Were they the worst tacos ever? No.   Were they good? No.  For a family of 3 we spent nearly $100 for food that was mediocre at best.  On a side note, to top off the experience, there weren't even paper towels or an air dryer to dry your hands in the bathroom.  The basic fish taco is better and cheaper at Rubio's so save yourself some money and go there instead if you're looking for basic that's cheap.  Needless to say we won't be going back.

What to do on a typical work day Wednesday???? That's right, happy hour! SoCal fish tacos was perfect for a mid-week happy hour. They have $1 tacos and some tasty drinks! Check it out and sit on the back patio for a nice relaxing happy hour!

I like the varieties of fish tacos they have here, especially for a pescatarian it means more options, lovely environment and the place is really cute, called in to make an order to pick up and it was very easy and fast, the staff are friendly too!

Well apparently if you order food or drinks 10 min before happy hour ends...your out of luck. You see...per the Manager that was on duty(younger gal, glasses, brown hair, ponytail, very rude)...So Cal's clock on
the register is 10 min ahead. So...that's the customers problem why????? I was absolutely in shock. My husband and I brought our 2 friends that day to show them how great this place was and this happened.   Not like we all just rolled in at 5:55....we already were there for over an hour and ordered lots of food/drinks. Oh yea...also 6 mini Coronas turned into 5. Took 20 min to get the 6th Corona. Oh and...menu says 3 rolled tacos on HH...we were brought 2. Menu changed and we were never told. So Cal...you just lost 4 customers.

My husband I came here for the first time on a Wednesday evening around 7:30 and had an enjoyable dinner.  

We ordered the calamari fries based on other Yelp reviews, but I didn't think they were amazing - they were just good.  To be honest, they reminded me of frozen fish sticks that you were forced to eat as a kid.  However, the accompanying dipping sauces added that extra umpf and made them pretty tasty.  

We also had the beer battered lobster tacos, which were a special.  They were great! I would definitely get those again. 

Service was fast, friendly and attentive.  The outside patio area was very quaint and relaxing.  Another great Gilbert restaurant!! :)

Gave this 4 star only because there were 4 or 5 wines on the menu but they only had Pinot Grigio or sangria.  Otherwise everything else was exceptional.  Our young lady server was very attentive.  The food tasted very fresh.  I had carne asada and carnitas tacos with rice.  Very good.  My wife had the beer battered mahi-mahi tacos with rice and beans which she also enjoyed.  Would definitely recommend this establishment to anyone.  We will go back and try some of their other dishes.  
P.S.  The happy hour wines for $4 were very generous pours.
The fish tacos are fresh and delicious, they are grilled so they have a lighter taste than the breaded and fried Mexican style fish tacos. The clam chowder is also fantastic!

Not to good! We started off there for happy hour. Even though they have a happy hour menu posted they would not honor it.
Instead they said they are going through menu changes. They pushed their taco specials and come to find out they are not very special. I ordered their lobster taco plater. The waiter seem to be training another gal and said the lobster is from Honduras and it's really good. When I received my lobster platter there was two tacos on it a 2 ounce cup of beans and the two ounce cup of rice. Once I started eating the tacos I found out there was more better than lobster they should change the name to battered lobster tacos with a hint of lobster. My Wife ordered the mahi tacos and was pretty much just as disappointed as the lobster platter. Before we got our taco platters we ordered shrimp ceviche tostadas they came out and we were surprised to find that one medium-sized shrimp was split into pieces of about a quarter inch that were divided over the to toast autos and were piled high with lettuce. They should change the name of the shrimp ceviche tostadas to a lettuce ceviche tostada because paying nine bucks for something like that is a bit ridiculous. And now we got the bill we had a couple of beers each the lobster special and the taco special that they put on it was 16 bucks each. So our bill came to 60 bucks when the waiter was pushing the taco platter is on us  as it was Taco Tuesday so buy one get one half off we had to point that out to them and get our bill adjusted.  We are taco connoisseurs and this place is for amateurs. If you want a good taco go to Julia's on Warner and Country Club. SoCal tacos in Gilbert so long we  won't be back. We'll be surprised if you're open another year. Nothing happy about their happy hour.

Went here as an out of towner based on a recommendation from my cousin. It's kind of a small place but a cool d√©cor, although it was so hot in there and not a single one of the ceiling fans were on.  One of the servers greeted and seated us right away and he was super nice. The server who actually served us, however, was so unpleasant.  The server's name on the receipt said Baylee and he had tattoos all down his arm. He hardly made eye contact, was walking away from me as I was speaking to him, and when I asked for a side of sauce, he returned without a word, slid it across the table, and walked away. Incredibly rude. The food was pretty decent but nothing extraordinary.  I got the cod tacos which were the perfect crispiness but were a little lacking in any kind of seasoning. It also comes with the smallest little sides of rice and beans I've ever seen. Not that great, I gave the majority of them to my boyfriend.  Overall not terrible, but not top notch in fish tacos. And the one server could use some lessons on customer service.

Good food. Fresh ingredients. Nice tartar sauce. Fish sandwich looked very good. Fish and chips were good, but not significantly  better than Long John Silver's or many other fish joints. My quest for a great fish and chips meal in the east valley will continue.

Glad I tried it, but they missed mark. Kinda explains why this is the one place in downtown Gilbert without a line out the door. Chips were stale, taco lacked flavor and the crab cakes were bread cakes with a touch of crab. On the positive, calamari fingers are worth trying.

Good was ok, a little too fried for me. Can get really pricey if your not at happy hour. But they do have a good happy hour with their oysters. It's probably the only place to get decent oysters downtown.

In town for a business trip. We were trying to decide between joyride tacos and SoCal fish taco company. Having never given SoCal a try we went that route. The tacos themselves were good but the accompanying and sides were less than stellar. The beans lacked flavor and salt. The rice came nothing close to resembling Spanish rice.  It was almost as if they had just made it with chicken broth. The restaurant was decorated nicely and had an overall California feel that was very inviting. The staff was friendly and attentive but did not make up for the food. Next time it is joy ride all the way.

The service was amazing but the food was mediocre. We ordered the mussels as an appetizer and it was delicious besides the fact that there was a soup of butter at the bottom of the bucket. I love seafood but covering them in butter is a sorry excuse for taste, personally. I ordered the beer battered mahi tacos, which were delicious and filling. My boyfriend ordered the tamale entree and it was an average tamale, nothing special. Portions were great, but the taste of the food was nothing special.
This place is starting to grow on me. I love the back patio open air seating. The coconut shrimp is off the hook!

In all fairness, I've only ever had the Cod Tacos but they were so good I came back 3 days in a row for more!  

The fish was crispy and perfectly sized to fill (not spill) the taco.  I'm pretty picky about tortillas but these had a nice texture (not the dry rubbery ones that come from that fish taco chain) and the cabbage / sauce was fresh and tasty.  I couldn't stop thinking about these tacos and had to go again... and again.  

The price was right, about 7 bucks for the two tacos and 2 sides - rice (which I liked and typically don't) and the beans (which I really liked).  

For me, the portion was perfect for lunch, just enough that I could barely poke it all into my smallish appetite but not so much that I had more than a bite or two left.

I called in my order all 3 times and it was ready in like 8 minutes, fresh and packaged really conveniently for a quick lunch in the car (parked, of course).

The d√©cor is really modern, sleek and inviting - the patio looks amazing and I'd love to try sometime when I have more time.

Parking was ample in back, there is a large parking lot and that's where you enter.
I was really hoping this was going to be great Mexican food, even if it was seafood.  My wife and I had it for lunch and we were not impressed.  Too bad.

I was excited to try So Cal before they opened. It's around the corner from my office, and I love a good fish taco. 

I ordered the blackened grouper taco plate, and my mom ordered the ahi tuna taco plate. 

My tacos were good. The fish wasn't technically "blackened" but it was tender and had good flavor. The tortillas were soft and warm and held up to the taco filling. They put just the right amount of cabbage on the tacos. I really enjoyed the baja sauce and cotija cheese. The rice and beans are quite average, no special flavors pop out. They purely serve the purpose of completing the plate.

The ahi tuna in my mom's tacos was WAY overcooked, and had an unappetizing grey hue. It was not pleasant to chew because it was so dry. She mentioned that to the server and his response was "Oh. Ok." and nothing else was done.

I will most likely be back, but not for the ahi tuna.
Best ceviche, best tacos, awesome outdoor patio, great shark tacos, great fish and chips! Only think wish they carried local beers and did bloody Mary's! Our new favorite spot!

Tried the restaurant for the first time since we live in the general area, it was very good and or service was excellent. Our server Avery was very attentive and stopped by many times to see how our food was and how we were doing. I really enjoyed the grilled mahi taco, it was very tasty. They have a really great happy hour menu, looking forward to trying it.
