Not a bad place. Portions are too small. Ordered the lobster tacos good quality just not enogh in the taco to fill you up (especially for 13 dollars) and the rice and beans are served in a sauce cup. Its like a sample. Definitely not enough food for the price.
Wait staff was very friendly and attentive! Lobster and Mahi tacos were amazing! Can't beat the prices either.
Really enjoyed going here for dinner.  I had fish tacos with rice and beans and the hubby had fish fry plate. We shared and it all tasted great. Good service too.
Good fish tacos but service was very slow.  They need to increase the size of their side of beans and rice.  They were served in condiment cups.

I usually enjoy this place.. open tables everywhere but couldn't be seated..?..  manager freaks out on the busser about seating ppl. harsh conversation about how the kitchen was going down... I left with my company from out of town embarrassed 8:10 pmTuesday he never once addressed any of the parties before or after us total chaos... I work in the area and you have lost my business for good.

Food tasted good.
Oysters were great, but no saltine crackers at all.
Hardly any shrimp on ceviche tostada and the nuttiest amount of fish possible on tacos.  That ruined it!

Went here this past weekend after a bike ride,  there is both indoor and outdoor seating, outdoor seating has heaters just in case it's chilly out. This was a great spot for an afternon lunch.  We  started with a couple of good ipa's served by can with a chilled glass.  The shrimp ceviche tostada appetizer came with 2 tostadas, they were delicious, only thing I added was tapatio. We also enjoyed the mussles that came with bread slices for dipping into the buttery, garlic goodness and of course we had to try the tacos,  lobster, shrimp and mahi . The server was attentive, friendly and helpful in deciding what to try.  We will be back to try the shrimp cocktail.

This place has a great variety of fish tacos and a nice patio to enjoy when the weather is nice.  My daughter particularly liked the couches outside. I got to relax for hours, drink a couple of tasty beers, and enjoy some fish tacos...no complaints there. 

The fish tacos tasted like they were on white corn tortillas, so had a nice mild flavor. We tried the mahi, tilapia, and shrimp tacos. The shrimp were easily my daughter's favorite.  They were good tacos, but not the best I've tasted. 

Ultimately, I will be back, beer in one hand , fish taco in the other.

Good selection of sea food items. Nice selection of craft beers and wines to complement your meal. Clam chowder can be an entree if you are looking to go lite. Many items are deep fried so ask your server what is and isn't. Great service by Mario. Strange to see heaters on a patio in Arizona but they felt good for our afternoon meal.

We had my soon to be sister in laws bridal shower here. They bent over backwards to make sure we were taken care of. It began to sprinkle and we were sitting in the lounge couch area out back which is uncovered. They quickly put up an easy up tent thingy and we were totally kept dry! Service was amazing, food was outstanding. I've been there a few times with a friend and loved the ombiance and food/service. I wanted to do the shower here because of the great experiences I'd had, now after Having been there in a larger group I am so completely amazed that they kept up to the high standard set in previous dates. Service and quality that is absolutely Above and beyond is usually hard to find. I love this place!! Oh yes and The shrimp tacos are to die for!
Very good. I thought $6.00 was high but it is a complete meal. They open a 11 am and I entered at 11:10 am and by 11:40 there we people waiting for a table.

Nice quaint location in downtown Gilbert. Limited indoor seating, has outdoor seating available, ample parking in public parking area behind the restaurant. 

Their menu is ample providing many choices. I tried their combo Mai and Blackened Grouper fish tacos, delicious and light fish, I wish the beans and rice was a larger serving. 

Overall good experience, great prices. Recommend highly if you like fish tacos.

Excellent prices and great food.  Had the cod tacos and chicken taquitos, finished off with a great handmade ice cream sandwich for dessert.  Great for lots of friends and families.  Sat out on the back patio under some umbrellas - middle of June in the Az and the umbrellas worked great.  Kids enjoyed it, finished their plates.  Loved this place!

OK.  Some of you wonder "So Warren, are there better fish taco's available?"  Yes, most certainly.  Here's a photo of 2 tacos, each going for $1.75.  When I compare this to So-Cal, well, there is no comparison.  Yes, there are better fish tacos out there, and they certainly aren't in downtown Gilbert.

What a disappointment.
I came her a few times last year and enjoyed the good foods/casual patio environment at a fair price.
Came here tonight and ordered a root beer float.
They were out of root beer so we asked for a doctor pepper float. Oh but they were out of ice cream too.
Came here to try the locos tacos but they couldn't make that. So my wife ordered the shark tacos. Wouldn't you know they we're out of shark.  They were also out of something else. The food was cold and everything kinda sucked. I wanted to walk out but i toughed it out and stayed...I should have walked out.

I have no idea why it took so damn long to come here! Grr on myself. Have driven by constantly on weekends and some weekdays when I'm close by, but never visited. I'm always at the Gilbert farmer's market & have visited Postinos with some gal pals, but have yearned to come here. Smack my forehead & say, "You dummy, Lil!" 

Totally and fantastically, awesome food! Took the fam out for a big lunch and wanted to check this place out, knowing that on a weekday during Fall Break it wasn't going to be busy...yet. Nice outdoor patio seating for lunch and it seats very nicely large groups (we have 6 in our family which includes a 19, 16yr & 11 yr old hungry boys). Service was excellent with our server being totally attentive and efficient. She was always there to check up on us in the midst of the growing lunch crowd, always filling up our drinks, and always being so cute & kind.
-Oysters were fresh & clean! Hubs & baby boy downed those in less than 5 mins; we should've ordered the dozen. It came with grated horseradish & cocktail sauce. 
-The clam chowder was creamy & loaded with nice-sized clams. An option would be to have it as a meal in a bread bowl, which will be for next visit.
- Calamari "fries" were cooked perfectly: light, not oily, crispy, and portion was good for an app for 2-3 peeps, not 6 (I got one, but let the kids have the rest). Would eat a whole order myself, but the main food is what I came for!
- Nice selection of fish tacos with choices of blackened, grilled, or beer-battered. Shark is also an option for the tacos - not sure if it would be Mako or Thresher...we'll have to see next time! Three of us ordered 1) grilled mahi-mahi with mango salsa, 2) blackened grouper, and 3) beer-battered cod. All approved and topped with Baja sauce & cojito cheese. Salsa on the side was tasty too. Tacos are served with pinto beans with peppers (didn't care for them) and Spanish rice (meh). A nice option or to kick it up a notch would be to omit those two items & replace them with black beans & lime and cilantro-style rice. That would be a more cohesive entree.
- Fish & chips...wow! Yummy, crispy goodness! The other 3 of us ordered that. Coleslaw was sweet which I prefer and the accompanying fries were seasoned. I think with 2 pieces of fish, fries & the coleslaw was proportioned well & filling.
- Other things to try for next time: clams & mussels apps, the Po' boy sammies, and salads. 
- A little pricey, more than what I'd spend in Cali when I go to similar establishments, but it was worth it to come, especially for fresh seafood like this out here in AZ.

Ready to go right back. I'm from Cali and the owners are too. It was nice to read their bio on one side of the menu, giving a nice & personable touch to their customers.This was the closest tasting thing that reminds me of home in all the years I've lived here - a laid back, mom & pops, outdoor, cool place to eat some fresh & fast cooking food. Seriously everything was so fresh, all we needed was a half dozen seagulls dive bombing around the tables, the salty air, and the sound of the waves. They also serve alcohol, a nice beer list too, but wasn't in the mood yesterday. We'll be back for sure!

First time here and we loved it.  Have heard good things from multiple people and finally made it over.  We sat outside, they have a nice area with bench tables, couches and tons of misters.  Our server was quick and attentive.  We had the batter d fish tacos and the shrimp tacos.  Each player comes with 2 tacos, rice and beens.  Very good food.
AWESOME! This eatery is a whole lot of delish! Fish tacos are some of the best I've had.  We will be back!

Went to SoCal for the 1st time tonight for date night and we loved it!  I had the Mahi Fish Tacos - I thought they were great.  Not too fishy, tasted fresh and the mango salsa and baja sauce was yummy!  My husband had the mussels, oysters on the half shell and crab cakes.  He was in heaven the whole time.  We aren't into specialty beers so we just had Coronas which is perfectly fine with us.  Loved the atmosphere and our waiter Ryan was super nice.  We already have plans to go back next Friday!
Definitely you need to try the coconuts Shrimp . For parents with toddlers they have a kids menu for them too   amazing place nice service!!!

Cute, cozy place. Our server was very helpful. They have a good selection of fish. I ordered the lobster taco special. They gave me the option of having it breaded or grilled. I tried grilled, and it was good. Like others have said it came with rice and beans. So with two tacos and the sides it was pretty filling. 

Overall it was good, but I probably won't go back. I love fish, but the baja/southern California fish tacos really aren't my favorite. Just personal preference.

My new FAVORITE restaurant! Thinking about the food makes my mouth salivate. Being that I was born in southern CA and have had fish tacos that are amazing, these ones have really become my favorite! Tried the mahi tacos and shrimp ceviche...delicious! I can't imagine anything not tasting like heaven from here! Well done!
Food was just ok - I also ordered takeout but they didn't care how it was packed and everything fell out of he boxes.  Small place cute with a SoCal beach taco shack feel.

C and I stopped here on the way to his first performance in AYT production of My Son Pinocchio. The place is pretty cool. I love the patio out back that just oozes relaxation.
Our server was Dylan. He was totally on his game. Attentive when we needed him but didn't make us feel rushed or bothered. He engaged C about his car books / magazines and as far as I'm concerned, if a server gives my son the time of day, that server is way ahead of the game at our table. You wouldn't believe how many servers disregard C which is funny because he knows quite a lot about food. (gets it from his old man :0)
C & I started with an order of Calamari Fries ($9.00). C was excited to see this on the menu because he loves the Calamari at The Elephant Bar which cuts the Calamari into fries (strips) just like here. The Calamari Fries were cooked perfectly. Golden breading surrounding a tender strip of Calamari. Yummy. The negative here was the portion size, for 9 bucks, could have been a bit larger.
C ordered the Cheese Crisp (HH $5.00) which was actually a Quesadilla. It was quite large for the money. Great deal. C loved it. The tortilla was nicely browned in spots, the cheese was oowey gooey goodness.  Winner winner cheese crisp dinner.
I ordered the Carnitas Tacos ($7.50). These tacos (3) were decent little tacos. They put down double corn tortillas and top them with the yummy pork, shredded lettuce, cheese & cilantro. On the side was Spanish rice, beans and some tasty salsa. The pork was tender and very flavorful. My only complaint would be that the kitchen needs to drain the pork for a few more seconds. On my tacos the pork was so wet it made the top tortilla unusable. Not that big of a deal.
C & I both had lemonade ($2.50 ea)
Great service, reasonable prices, clean groovy dining space & patio, great Calamari, great Cheese Crisp, great Port Tacos. 4.5 Stars

The interior looks a little like a rubios but it was actually so much nicer. We got here at 11 on a weekday and it was packed within 30 minutes.  The server was perfect - friendly but not intrusive. 

The food came out piping hot. We had the calamari fries. They were bigger strips but tender and flavorful. I really liked the aoli. 

Also had the scallops and chips. Felt a little overcooked but still tender inside. Did not care for the fries, they were bland and boring. The tacos looked amazing!

I have been coming here for a year or so... Six months ago they would of received 5 stars but I feel the food quality has gone downhill slightly. I have always ordered the cod tacos & the tortilla soup (the soup is amazing) the last 3/4 times the tacos have been overcooked & hard... I will continue to come & hopefully they will get better Also I wish they were open on Sundays, they would get tons of business.
This is my go to place for the best Fish Tacos. I always sit on the patio and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere.

Amazing, amazing, amazing, amazing!

I've lived here 8.5 years, and I'm sad it took me so long to eat at this gem. I've eaten there nearly once a week since my first visit 6 weeks ago. 

To be fair, being from the Gulf area, I'm always leery of seafood places here in AZ. Let me put your mind at ease: the seafood here is so good! I don't know where they get it from or how they get it here, but they do a fantastic job. 

My first time, I tried the Tacos Locos and they are so delicious, (a burst of complementary flavors dancing on your tastebuds) I haven't changed my order. I have shared the ceviche with my husband which I would also recommend. 

My husband has had the grouper and shark tacos, both which he has raved about. My friend who accompanied me on one visit ate the fish and chips. He was very satisfied. I would recommend eating non fried fish at this place, though, because it's so great. 

The service has always been good at each of my visits. The place is small, so I recommend going at non-peak times.

Our first time at this brand new restaurant and I am please to say it was a first class experience.

We visited for lunch just a couple of days after opening so expected them to still be working things out but everything went smoothly. As a Brit I had to go with their $6 Fish & Chips. For that price I expected a smaller portion but the two pieces of fish were a decent size and it was more than enough for lunch. The fish was tasty and the batter cooked perfectly. Served with Tartar sauce and lemon, these guys understand how to cook my national dish (they even had malt vinegar for the chips ... bloody marvelous!).

My lunch companion enjoyed two 'delicious' fish tacos and also said it was the right amount for lunch. 

Well priced, friendly service and a very cool look to the restaurant makes SoCal Fish Company a place I will be returning to again.

I was a regular for a while and moved to far.  I brought my friend. It was so awkward because the first half of our visit all the employees were so loud during our visit. It was not pleasant. Please be more professional.

Both my husband and I had SoCal bookmarked for a while so last Saturday we stopped in for lunch. My husband ordered the beer battered fish tacos (Cod, I believe) and I ordered clam strips with a cup of New England clam chowder. My food was great but my husband's tacos were just so-so, they definitely needed more sauce to add some flavor but the fry on the fish was so crispy.  What left a bad taste in my mouth was the owner. He was not friendly or welcoming whatsoever. I'm not saying you HAVE to be friendly but when we walked in, he didn't greet us, and when we left he didn't even acknowledge us, not a "thanks for coming" or a "how was the food, guys?" He definitely looked at us though. I'm not chatty by any means so I wouldn't have wanted to make small talk but personally, I like being made to feel welcome when patronizing a business. I asked my husband if it was just me who felt that way but he said he got a weird vibe too.  First and last time at SoCal, for sure, but giving three stars because I did enjoy my food and our waitress was super attentive and kept our drinks filled at all times.

Stopped in for lunch today and everything was good.  I had the blackened grouper tacos and my girlfriend had the shrimp tacos.  Both were excellent but I lean towards the grouper.  The spicy kick added with the salsa was awesome.  Even the small sides of beans and rice were good.  Very friendly staff, quick service and reasonable price for lunch.  Highly recommend this new downtown Gilbert addition.

The tacos were okay.... My beer was barely cold, I had a burgundy colored hair wrapped around my mahi mahi taco which really made me sick. Any good restraunt would have just taken it off the bill. But nope. They discounted it 5$... I had to wait to eat while they remade my taco. The mahi , cod and sword fish -they taste exactly the same so save a few bucks and just get the cod. Lol  I like trying new places but I probably won't ever come here again. Don't waste your money-- del tacos fish tacos taste better

Pretty good food. Our server, nice young lady, was very helpful. Our January 10, 2015 dining experience was compromised, however, by a different young male server, believe his name was Josh, who couldn't get away from a table of HIS friends using junior high-level language/humor and talking excessively loud about pretty much nothing.

Love the downtown Gilbert area and happy this place opened. Love the decor and the service was good. Very laid back, plastic and paper kinda place. The clam chowder was not as anticipated, wish it had more clams but the shrimp tacos were good. I liked the Cotija cheese and Baja sauce on it. The cheese had a feta taste which give it a little edge. My friend had the fish & chips and said it was very fresh. The Left Coast amber beer was pretty good too.
What a chill place with a nice patio and fresh shrimp tacos! If you close your eyes you almost feel like you're at the beach-I can't wait to come back and try everything on the menu...

Service is a bit spotty, but the tacos are delicious! Took almost 45 mins to get seated the first time and seated immediately the second time.

 To be honest I'm not typically a fan of fish tacos. I like seafood I like tacos. Not thrilled with them together. When I had my first bite of fish taco here my initially reaction was "not sure if just really hungry or best fish taco I've ever had!" (After the first 45 min wait). Went back yesterday and confirmed yeah probably best fish taco ever.
Love this place!!  Fresh fish tacos in Az. hard to come by.

This place is delicious! It may be tiny but the patio is amazing. The food was astoundingly good. I wished I could eat more. I love the selection for the tacos and the fact that you can mix and match. I had the Shrimp and the Cod. I preferred the shrimp but I see why the Cod is a big seller. Our server was super sweet and helpful. I can't wait to go back for happy hour!

Love this place!  Great homemade chips and salsa.  Fish and Chips, Chicken Tacos and Fish Tacos are what I have tried and all were very good.  The inside is small and there could be a long wait, especially during the summer months here in Arizona.  However, they have a great patio section and now that it is cooling off, I would choose to sit outside.  Definitely reccomend.  The owner and staff are very friendly and attentive.

Downtown Gilbert has exploded with restaurant options over the past year or so. Most are amazing, there's no doubt about that. SoCal is no exception. We've be there dozens of times, and SoCal continues to be our go-to spot on Friday nights!
I ate here last Saturday with the Fam bam. We all walked out raving about the food and what we were going to eat next time! I had the oyster po boy..yumm
Pretty good... Not as good as "Wahoos" in California. Very friendly staff, fresh food. Awesome clam strips.

Shrimp tamale. OMFG. My friend asked why I kept moaning, lol. I wasn't even embarrassed. That was hands down the BEST entree ever. I brought one home for my son to try and all I heard was "Aw man. Oh wow." and the fork scraping the plate. I wasn't a huge fan of the rice or beans, but that tamale and the cup of clam chowder were on point...Oh yes, I'll be back.

Why didn't I know about this place?? My Daughter and I decided to check it out when we had a rare night to ourselves and so glad we did! We had the crab cakes for an appetizer and they were just delicious and could have been a meal in themselves. The waitress said the magic "L" word(lobster) as a special so I had the lobster tacos. Yummy yummy yummy! Prices are reasonable and I like that the patio is in back, not out on busy Gilbert Road. We will definitely be there again and again!!

I honestly don't know how this place has that many stars. The food was not even close to saying it was good. I guess if it was the only food left, of course I'd eat it. Let's start w the crab cakes, no flavor. Had a slight crisp to it, thick but no flavor. Ordered a side of aioli to give it flavor. The mussels, the sauce was so salty. The side pieces of bread were just slices of bread, not even toasted. DO NOT ORDER THE SHRIMP PO BOY. All it is, is fried shrimp in a big roll of bread. THATS IT. No sauce whatsoever. If you've had a true Po boy as I have (Louisiana) then you will be so disappointed. Seriously they should state in the menu "fried shrimp in a big roll of bread. Dry as heck". My buddy got the shrimp tacos, no flavor. I don't know if the people who reviewed this place only come from AZ where seafood is not great because true seafood lovers would know the difference. Place is gross. I guess the idea and outside set up is cool (inside was super small and diner ish) service was good though, so keep that up! Never returning. Ever.
Food is priced well, and not bad, but this place is sketchy. You can hear managers yelling at servers, and speaking very unprofessionally. Also, they have received numerous health code violations...
Fantastic food and great service! last week i had the Halibut fish and chips and it was perfecto!! yummmm! I also love their shrimp and chips!

I think the atmosphere was good. I think I ordered poorly. I got the fish cerveche and my husband got the coconut shrimp. We also got some calamari fries. I should've got something hot and a meal. Our three things were $30. Service was ok but not real into making it more than putting our food order in. I probably would go elsewhere for tacos.

If it wasn't for the service I received from my server I would give this place 5 stars. The busboy on the other hand was phenomenal I gave him the tip. 

But I will be back the food was sooooo yummy. I had the scallop tacos and my daughter had the salmon wrap. So good!!!!!!! My other two had the popcorn chicken on the kids menu it tasted like frozen chicken and fries. But that's expected it's a fish place.

One of my favorite spots for quick, affordable good food! The staff is always friendly and helpful, and Pablo the owner is usually there and does whatever he can to make sure all his customers enjoy their experience. The shrimp ceviche and the clam chowder are two of my favorites, especially if I'm in a rush and need to get in and out.

My wife and I absolutely love SoCal Fish Taco Company. My favorite tacos are the grilled Mahi Mahi. Have also has the cod tacos and calamari fries - also both very good. Price is right, location is great in downtown Gilbert and the staff is friendly. They have a few SoCal craft beers to choose from - really like the Coronado Brewing IPA. 

There are several fish taco shops we like in San Diego, SoCal Fish Taco company is bringing those great tacos to Gilbert. Great work guys, keep it up.
